column1: Located on a broad saddle between two mountains, the area also contains the marshy Datun Pond.
column2: 该区域位于两山之间的鞍部，此处还有泥泞的大屯池。

column1: To the southeast of the city lie the Songshan Hills and the Qingshui Ravine, which form a barrier of lush woods.
column2: 城市的东南部有松山和清水谷，形成了一道茂密树立的隔断。

column1: When compared to other Asian cities, Taipei has "excellent" capabilities for managing air quality in the city.
column2: 与其他亚洲城市相比，台北拥有“很棒”的城市空气质量治理能力。

column1: Its rainy climate, location near the coast, and strong environmental regulations have prevented air pollution from becoming a substantial health issue, at least compared to cities in southeast Asia and industrial China.
column2: 由于其气候多雨、位置近海、环境法规严格，因此至少与东南亚和工业化中国城市相比，空气污染没有成为严重的健康问题。

column1: However, smog is extremely common and there is poor visibility throughout the city after rain-less days.
column2: 但是，雾霾非常普遍，城市在雨水少的日子后能见度很低。

column1: Motor vehicle engine exhaust, particularly from motor scooters, is a source of air pollution in Taipei.
column2: 机动车（特别是摩托车）引擎排放的废气是台北空气污染的来源。

column1: There are higher levels of fine particulate matter and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the mornings because of less air movement; sunlight reduces some pollution.
column2: 由于早上空气流动缓慢，空气中有较高浓度的细颗粒物和多环芳烃；阳光可减少部分污染。

column1: As Taiwan's business, financial, and technology hub, Taipei has been at the center of rapid economic development in the country and has now become one of the global cities in technology and electronics.
column2: 台北作为台湾的商业、金融和科技中心，已经成为该地区经济快速发展的中心，现已成为全球科技与电子城市之一。

column1: This development is part of the so-called Taiwan Miracle which has seen dramatic growth in the city following foreign direct investment in the 1960s.
column2: 这段发展是所谓的台湾奇迹的一部分，在 20 世纪 60 年引入外商直接投资后，城市经历了迅猛发展。

column1: Taiwan is now a creditor economy, holding one of the world's largest foreign exchange reserves of over US$403 billion as of December 2012.
column2: 台湾现在是债权经济体，截至 2012 年 12 月为止，拥有世界上最大的外汇储备之一，总额超过 4030 亿美元。

column1: Despite the Asian financial crisis, the economy continues to expand at about 5% per year, with virtually full employment and low inflation.
column2: 虽然亚洲爆发了金融危机，但该经济体继续保持每年 5% 的增长，几乎没有人失业，通货膨胀率低。

column1: The city's GDP stand at US$327 billion in 2014.
column2: 2014 年，该城市的 GDP 达到 3270 亿美元。

column1: As of 2013, the nominal GDP per capita in Taipei city is 5th highest in East Asia, behind Tokyo, Singapore, Osaka, and Hong Kong, but ahead of Seoul, as well as London and Paris, according to The Economist.
column2: 根据《经济学人》报道，到 2013 年为止，台北市的名义人均 GDP 在东亚排名第五，仅次于东京、新加坡、大阪和香港，但比首尔以及伦敦和巴黎高。

column1: GDP per capita based on Purchasing Power Parity (PPP) in Taipei in 2015 was US$44173, behind that of Singapore (US$90151 in 2016 from the IMF) and Hong Kong (US$58322 in 2016 from the IMF; also based on PPP).
column2: 2015 年，台北基于购买力平价（PPP）计算的人均 GDP 为 44173 美元，仅次于新加坡（根据国际货币基金组织数据，2016 年为 90151 美元）和香港（根据国际货币基金组织数据，2016 年为 58322 美元；基于购买力平价计算）。

column1: The Financial Times ranked Taipei highly in economic potential (2nd, behind Tokyo) and business friendliness (4th) in 2015.
column2: 2015 年，《金融时报》将台北列入经济潜力（第 2 名，仅次于东京）和营商友好度（第 4 名）的前位。

column1: The city is home to 30 billionaires, the 16th most in the world, ahead of many global cities such as Los Angeles and Sydney.
column2: 该城市有 30 名亿万富翁，人数排名全世界第 16，超过洛杉矶和悉尼等许多国际城市。

column1: Business Insider also ranks Taipei the 5th most high-tech city globally, the highest in Asia, in 2017.
column2: 2017 年，《商业内幕》也把台北列为全球第五大高科技城市，亚洲城市中排名最高。

column1: While the IESE Cities in Motion Index 2017 ranks Taipei as the smartest technology city globally.
column2: 2017年 IESE 动态城市指数把台北列为全球最智能的科技城市。

column1: Taipei's main development fields include the information and communications technology (hardware and software), biotechnology, general merchandising (wholesale/retail), financial services, and MICE industries.
column2: 台北的主要发展领域包括信息与通讯技术（硬件及软件）、生物技术、日用百货（批发/零售）、金融服务和会展产业。

column1: Most of the country's major firms are based there including Asus, CTBC Bank, Fubon Financial Holding, Tatung Company, D-Link, and others.
column2: 该地区大部分大型企业的总部都设于此，包括华硕、中国信托商业银行、富邦金融控股公司、大同公司、友讯科技等。

column1: 5 Global Fortune 500 companies are headquartered in Taipei.
column2: 5 个全球财富 500 强企业的总部都在台北。

column1: The city also attracts many multi-national corporations, international financial institutions, foreign consulates, and business organizations to set up base there.
column2: 该城市也吸引了许多跨国企业、国际金融机构、外国领事馆和商业组织到此设立总部。

column1: Thus, Taipei has nearly 3,500 registered foreign businesses and attracts over 50% of the total foreign investment in Taiwan.
column2: 因此，台北有将近 3,500 家注册外国企业，吸引的外资占台湾外资总额的 50%。

column1: Foreign companies with offices or regional headquarters in Taipei include Google, Microsoft, IBM, Intel, HSBC, Citibank, Facebook, Amazon, Apple, JP Morgan, PwC, and many others.
column2: 在台北设有办公室或地区总部的外国企业包括谷歌、微软、IBM、因特尔、汇丰银行、花旗银行、Facebook、亚马逊、Apple、摩根大通、普华永道等。

column1: Most financial and foreign firms like to reside in the central business district of Taipei, the Xinyi Special District.
column2: 大多数金融和外国企业都喜欢将办公室设在台北中央商业区，即信义计划区。

column1: With Citi, JP Morgan, DBS Bank, Cathay Life Insurance, Shin Kong Commercial Bank, Hua Nan Bank, and soon Fubon Financial and Nan Shan Life Insurance all establishing skyscrapers in the area.
column2: 花旗银行、摩根大通、星展银行、国泰人寿、星光商业银行、华南银行以及富邦金融和南山人寿纷纷在此区域建起摩天大楼。

column1: Meanwhile, technology and electronics companies are often colocated in the Neihu Technology Park or the Nankang Software Park.
column2: 同时，科技与电子公司通常搬往内湖科技园区或南港软体园区。

column1: The startup and innovation scene in Taipei is also very vibrant.
column2: 台北的创业及创新领域也蓬勃发展。

column1: In 2018 alone, Microsoft announced plans to invest US$34 million to create an artificial intelligence R&D center in Taipei, while Google announced it will hire 300 people and train 5,000 more in artificial intelligence for machines.
column2: 仅 2018 年，微软宣布计划投资 340 万美元，在台北创建人工智能研发中心，谷歌也宣布将在机器人工智能方面聘用 300 名员工和培训超过 5,000 名员工。

column1: Taipei is currently Google's biggest engineering site in Asia.
column2: 台北现在是谷歌在亚洲最大的工程地。

column1: IBM also announced in 2018 that it will develop a cloud research lab and expand its R&D center in Taipei with eyes on artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and cloud computing.
column2: 2018 年，IBM 也宣布建立云研究实验室，并扩张其在台北的研发中心，专注于研究人工智能、区块链技术和云计算。

column1: According to the 2016 Global Entrepreneurship Development Index, Taipei's entrepreneurial spirit ranks 6th worldwide and 1st in Asia.
column2: 根据 2016 全球创业精神暨发展指数，台北的创业精神位列全球第 6 名，亚洲第 1 名。

column1: Taipei has more than 400 startups and numerous incubation centers, accelerators, venture capitals, and angel investors.
column2: 台北有超过 400 家初创企业和许多孵化中心、加速器、风险资本和天使投资者。

column1: The city's startup ecosystem is valued at US$580 million by Startup Genome in 2018.
column2: Startup Genome 2018 年的数据显示，该城市初创生态系统价值 5.8 亿美元。

column1: Tourism is a small but significant component of the local economy with international visitors totaling almost 3 million in 2008. Taipei has many top tourist attractions and contributes a significant amount to the US$6.8 billion tourism industry in Taiwan.
column2: 旅游业是当地经济占比较小但很重要的组成部分，2008 年境外游客总人数达到将近三百万。台北有许多受欢迎的旅游景点，为台湾旅游业贡献了 68 亿美元的巨额收入。

column1: Tourism is a major part of Taipei's economy.
column2: 旅游业是台北经济的主要组成部分。

column1: In 2013, over 6.3 million overseas visitors visited Taipei, making the city the 15th most visited globally.
column2: 2013 年，超过 630 万海外游客到访台北，台北在全球游客人数排名中位列第 15。

column1: The influx of visitors contributed US$10.8 billion to the city's economy in 2013, the 9th highest in the world and the most of any city in the Chinese-speaking world.
column2: 2013 年，到访游客为该城市的经济贡献了 108 亿美元收入，全球排名第 9 位，在中文世界城市中排名第一。

column1: The National Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall is a famous monument, landmark and tourist attraction that was erected in memory of General Chiang Kai-shek, former President of the Republic of China.
column2: 中正纪念堂是闻名的纪念馆、地标和景点，为纪念中华民国前总统蒋介石将军而建。

column1: The structure stands at the east end of Memorial Hall Square, site of the National Concert Hall and National Theater and their adjacent parks as well as the memorial.
column2: 雕像立于纪念堂广场西边，即国家音乐厅与国家戏剧院和邻近公园以及纪念堂的交汇处。

column1: The landmarks of Liberty Square stand within sight of Taiwan's Presidential Office Building in Taipei's Zhongzheng District.
column2: 自由广场地标就位于台北中正区台湾总统府视野范围内。

column1: Yang was born 10 November 1958 in the Wen Qiang village, Cibihu town of Dali, Yunnan province.
column2: 杨丽萍于 1958 年 11 月 10 日出生在云南省大理州茈碧湖镇文强村。

column1: She the eldest of four children.
column2: 她在四个孩子中排行老大。

column1: Her parents and grandparents, members of the Bai ethnic minority, were farmers in a nearby village.
column2: 她的父母和祖父母都是白族，是附近村庄的农民。

column1: Her grandmother was a singer in the village.
column2: 她的祖母是村里的一名歌手。

column1: Yang began her formal dance training at the late age of 11, at a dance troupe in the Xishuangbanna area of Yunnan, after her family moved to the area.
column2: 11 岁时，杨家搬到了云南西双版纳地区，随后杨丽萍加入了一个舞蹈团并开始了正规的舞蹈训练。

column1: In the Southern flatlands of Yunnan, Xishuangbanna borders the country of Burma and is dominated by the Dai ethnic group, whose Peacock dance she would become synonymous with.
column2: 西双版纳云南南部的平原，与缅甸接壤，是傣族的聚居地，她跳的孔雀舞就是傣族的代名词。

column1: In her early 20's, after she moved to Beijing to dance with the Central Nationalities Song and Dance Ensemble, she made the peacock dance her own, recasting parts of it with deft arm and finger movements.
column2: 在 20 岁出头时，她因调入中央民族歌舞团而前往北京，把孔雀舞变成了自己的舞蹈，用灵巧的手臂和手指动作重新塑造了孔雀舞的一部分。

column1: In 1986, that choreography and dance won her first prize in a national competition.
column2: 1986 年，她编排和表演的这一舞蹈在全国比赛中获得了第一名。

column1: She rose to national level fame in 1986 when she won first prize in a national dance competition for her original solo "Spirt of the Peacock" (雀之灵).
column2: 1986 年，她的原创独舞《雀之灵》在全国舞蹈比赛中获得第一名，从而在全国一举成名。

column1: Ever since, she has been dubbed the "Peacock Princess".
column2: 从那时起，她就被称为“孔雀公主”。

column1: She was the director, choreographer and star of "Dynamic Yunnan", a show that drew sellout crowds all over China.
column2: 她是《云南映象》的导演、编舞和主演，这部舞台剧在中国吸引了大批观众。

column1: She toured Europe and the United States in 2005.
column2: 2005 年，她在欧洲和美国开展了巡回演出。

column1: Between 2004 and 2008, Yang Liping directed and choreographed a trilogy: "Dynamic Yunnan", "Echoes of Shangri-la" and "Tibetan Myth".
column2: 2004 年至 2008 年期间，杨丽萍导演并编排了三部曲：《云南映象》、《香格里拉的回音》和《西藏神话》。

column1: In 2004, "Dynamic Yunnan" won five major awards at the National Lotus Awards, including Gold Award for Dance Spectacular, Best Choreography and Best Female Performer.
column2: 2004 年，《云南映象》获得中国舞蹈“荷花奖”的五个奖项，包括舞蹈诗金奖、最佳编导奖和最佳女主角奖等。

column1: To create the exotic song and dance spectacular "Dynamic Yunnan", Yang spent years traveling to remote villages of the 26 ethnic minority tribes in Yunnan and selected over 60 peasants who had the natural gift of song and dance, from whom she built an archive re-creating this rich feast of sight and sound.
column2: 为了创作充满异域风情的歌舞表演《云南映像》，杨花费数年时间走访云南省 26 个少数民族部落所在的偏远村寨，挑选了 60 多位具备歌舞天赋的农民，依靠这些人，她建立起一座能重现这一视听盛宴的档案库。

column1: In May 2009, she revealed a dance and music production 'Yunnan Sound', at the Yunnan Art Institute's Experimental Theater.
column2: 2009 年 5 月，她在云南艺术学院试验剧场展示了一部名为《云南的响声》的舞蹈和音乐作品。

column1: On November 17, 2009, US President Barack Obama is visit to China, she performed the classic dance "The Spirit of the Birds" at the Great Hall of the People.
column2: 2009 年 11 月 17 日，美国总统奥巴马到访中国，她在人民大会堂表演了经典舞蹈《雀之灵》。

column1: She is currently a judge on So You Think You Can Dance China.
column2: 她目前担任《舞林争霸》节目的评委。

column1: Yang's first husband was a colleague of the Central National Song and Dance Troupe and later divorced.
column2: 杨的第一任丈夫是中央民族歌舞团的同事，后离婚。

column1: The current husband, Liu Yuqing, is a Taiwanese-American.
column2: 现任丈夫刘淳晴是一名美籍台胞。

column1: They couple met in 1990 and married in 1995, but Yang wants to dance long-term dieting and cannot be pregnant.
column2: 两人于 1990 年相识，1995 年结婚，但杨想要跳舞，长期节食，因而无法生育。

column1: After getting her bachelor's degree in Architecture at the National Central University in Chongqing, China, Wang Chiu-Hwa moved to Seattle to continue her studies at the University of Washington in 1946.
column2: 从中国重庆的中央大学取得建筑学学士学位之后，王秋华于 1946 年前往位于西雅图的华盛顿大学继续深造。

column1: She then studied a Masters of Architecture at Columbia University in New York.
column2: 之后她在纽约的哥伦比亚大学攻读建筑学硕士。

column1: From 1953 to 1979, Wang Chiu-Hwa worked with American architect Percival Goodman in New York.
column2: 1953 年至 1979 年，王秋华在纽约与美国建筑师珀西瓦尔·古德曼一起工作。

column1: She began working for him part-time as designer while still his student, and then worked for him full-time for almost thirty years, starting as an associate in 1960 and then becoming a partner.
column2: 她在作为他的学生时就已开始担任他的兼职设计师，随后为他全职工作近三十年，一开始在 1960 年担任助理，之后成为合伙人。

column1: Goodman exerted great influence on her architectural ideas; like Goodman, she strongly believes in the notion of the architect as having a social responsibility through their work.
column2: 古德曼对她的建筑理念产生了极大的影响；与古德曼一样，她坚信建筑师通过自身工作而承担社会责任。

column1: Wang Chiu-Hwa returned to Taiwan in 1979.
column2: 王秋华于 1979 年回到台湾。

column1: She began teaching at the Taipei Institute of Technology and Tamkang University, and served as architectural consultant to a number of public institutions.
column2: 她开始在台北科技大学和淡江大学任教，并担任多家公共机构的建筑顾问。

column1: In 1983, after collaborating with architect Joshua J. Pan on the Chung Yuan Christian University library, she started her own practice and has since been working in joint venture with J. J. Pan and Partners, Architects and Planners, on a number of projects.
column2: 1983 年，在与建筑师潘冀合作完成中原大学图书馆之后，她开始独立执业，此后一直与潘冀联合建筑师事务所在许多项目上进行合作。

column1: Wang Chiu-Hwa's architectural designs are modernistic, with emphasis on environmental totality and scale.
column2: 王秋华的建筑设计为现代主义风格，强调环境整体性和规模。

column1: In 1983–85, she designed the main library of Chung Yuan Christian University, which exemplifies her sense of spatial planning.
column2: 1983-85 年，她设计了中原大学的主图书馆，这一建筑体现出她的空间规划意识。

column1: It has a holding capacity of 700,000 volumes, a conference room with room for 150 people, and a study room with room for 800 people.
column2: 该馆可藏书 70 万册，有一间可容纳 150 人的会议室，还有一间可供 800 人使用的自习室。

column1: Its multiple-entry plazas and sunken gardens were designed to encourage socialising.
column2: 其多入口广场和下沉式花园的设计旨在鼓励社交。

column1: A special feature of the library is the attention given to energy conservation.
column2: 该图书馆的一大特点是注重节能。

column1: Natural lighting and ventilation were made possible through the use of double-height spaces, also providing visual fluidity and transparency.
column2: 通过采用双层挑高空间，实现自然光照和通风，同时还带来视觉上的流动性和透明度。

column1: This was her first major project after returning to Taiwan, and it won her the Taiwan Provincial Building Design Award and the National Building Design Award for Passive Energy Efficiency.
column2: 这是她回到台湾之后的首个大项目，为她赢得台湾省政府优良建筑设计奖和“内政部”建筑节约能源优良设计奖。

column1: Over the next three decades, she designed a number of large and award-winning buildings in Taiwan, including but not limited to:
column2: 之后的三十年间，她在台湾设计了许多获奖的大型建筑，包括但不限于：

column1: 1986: Precision Instruments Development Center for the National Science Council
column2: 1986 年：国科会精密仪器发展中心

column1: 1988: Medical Research Building & Conference Center for Veterans’ Hospital in Taichung
column2: 1988 年：台中荣民总医院研究大楼及会议中心

column2: 1989 年：中原大学体育馆

column2: 1989 年：国立彰化师范大学图书馆

column2: 1991-97 年：台中荣总医护单身宿舍

column2: 1993 年：国立中正大学图书馆及资讯中心

column2: 1998 年：台北中国文化大学创办人纪念图书馆

column2: 1997-2004 年：中原大学全人教育村

column2: 2000-2005 年：中国文化大学体育馆

column1: Recognized for her many achievements, she was named Outstanding Architect of Taiwan ROC in 2003.
column2: 她的众多成就获得认可，在 2003 年被评为中华民国杰出建筑师。

column1: Chunghwa Telecom is the largest telecommunication service provider in Taiwan and one of the largest in Asia in terms of revenue.
column2: 中华电信是台湾最大的电信服务提供商，也是亚洲收入最高的电信服务提供商之一。

column1: In terms of both revenue and customers, Chunghwa is Taiwan's largest provider of fixed line services, mobile services, broadband access service, and Internet service.
column2: 就收入和客户而言，中华电信是台湾最大的固定电话服务、移动服务、宽带接入服务和互联网服务提供商。

column1: The company also provides information and communication technology services to corporate customers.
column2: 该公司还为企业客户提供信息和通信技术服务。

column1: HiNet has been heavily criticised for being a haven for senders of email spam, which has resulted in many Internet service providers routinely blocking e-mails originating from the service.
column2: HiNet 因成为垃圾邮件发送者的避风港而饱受批评，这导致许多互联网服务提供商通常拦截来自该服务的电子邮件。

column1: Senao International, a cellular phone distributor from which Senao Networks, manufacturer of data networking products and wireless telephones under the EnGenius and Senao brands was spun off.
column2: 森奥国际是一家手机分销商，生产 EnGenius 和森奥品牌的数据网络产品和无线电话机的森奥网络从中剥离出来。

column1: Chen Long-bin was born in 1964 in Taipei, Taiwan.
column2: 陈龙斌 1964 年出生于台湾台北。

column1: He received a BFA from the Fine Arts Department at Tunghai University, and an MFA from the School of Visual Arts in New York.
column2: 他获得东海大学美术系艺术学士学位和纽约视觉艺术学院艺术硕士学位。

column1: He is known for using the cultural debris of our modern society, such as old, discarded books, newspapers, phonebooks, and magazines as the medium for his sculptures.
column2: 他以使用我们现代社会的文化碎片作为雕塑媒介而闻名，例如被丢弃的旧的书籍、报纸、电话簿和杂志。

column1: Chen is self-taught in carving wood, but started showing interest in our paper culture as a viable material for art – phonebooks, magazines, and computer paper when PC’s began growing popular in 1993.
column2: 陈龙斌自学木雕，当个人电脑在 1993 年开始流行时，他开始表现出对于把我们的纸文化（电话簿、杂志和电脑用纸）作为一种可行的艺术材料的兴趣。

column1: The advent of the personal computer changed the entire nature of information documentation – a role books used to play.
column2: 个人电脑的出现彻底改变了信息记录的性质，书本曾经发挥这一作用。

column1: Thus, by turning paper into the original wood for his sculptures, Chen offers renewed value to the meaning of paper.
column2: 因此，通过把纸变成其雕塑的原木，陈龙斌为纸张赋予了新的价值。

column1: He uses chainsaws, drills, band saws, sanders, and scissors, along with other carpenter's tools to shape his remarkable busts and figures, which appear stone, or even marble like from a distance.
column2: 他使用电锯、钻头、带锯、打磨机和剪刀，以及其他木匠工具来塑造他出众的半身像和人像，从远处看就像是石头甚至是大理石。

column1: Chen who has won prizes in Europe, Taipei, and Japan, has exhibited extensively at galleries and museums for many years in Japan, Korea, France, (Germany), Hong Kong, Italy, London, Singapore, Taiwan, and the United States, and can also be found in numerous international public and private collections.
column2: 陈龙斌曾在欧洲、台北和日本获奖，多年来在日本、韩国、法国、（德国）、香港、意大利、伦敦、新加坡、台湾和美国的画廊及博物馆大量展出，也出现在众多国际公开及私人收藏中。

column1: He has been awarded artist fellowship grants from Taiwan's National Endowment for the Arts, the Joan Mitchell Foundation in New York and the Freeman Foundation.
column2: 他曾获得台湾国家艺术基金会、纽约琼·米切尔基金会和弗里曼基金会的艺术家奖金资助。

column1: In 1995, he received the Visitor's Prize of the Sixth Triennial of Small Scale Sculpture in Stuttgart, Germany.
column2: 1995 年，他在德国斯图加特获得第六届小型雕塑三年展观众票选奖。

column1: And in 1998, he received the Silver Prize at the Osaka Triennial in Japan.
column2: 1998 年，他在日本获得大阪三年展银牌奖。

column1: For Chen, using recycled materials to make art stresses the challenges presented by endless human consumption and waste, as well as the tantamount ecological problems of waste accumulation and disposal, the destruction of forests, and the mindless use of nonrenewable resources.
column2: 对陈龙斌而言，使用回收材料进行艺术创作突出了人类无休止的消费和浪费所带来的挑战，以及垃圾积累及处理、破坏森林和盲目使用不可再生资源所造成的巨大生态问题。

column1: The reams of used computer paper disprove the assurance of the electronic paper-less office, which instead augments the use of paper, as printing is made much easier.
column2: 成堆的废旧电脑纸反驳了信誓旦旦的电子无纸化办公，由于打印变得更加便捷，这种做法反而增加了纸张使用。

column1: Furthermore, his choice of medium also poses as a commentary on the loss of books as aesthetic objects, which have been replaced by mass-produced cheaply made paperbacks.
column2: 此外，他对媒介的选择也对书籍不再是审美对象进行了实况报道，书籍已被大规模生产的廉价纸质书所取代。

column1: Books are extremely important to Chen.
column2: 书籍对陈龙斌而言极其重要。

column1: However, it is not the book itself, but its educational heritage, literary importance, historical knowledge, and the sacredness of the written word that he treasures most.
column2: 然而，他最珍视的不是书籍本身，而是书的教育遗产、文学重要性、历史知识和文字的神圣性。

column1: The type of materials he acquires in a sense determines the sculpture he creates.
column2: 他获得的材料类型在某种意义上决定了他创作的雕塑。

column1: While in New York, he scoured the streets of Manhattan collecting discarded refuse, scouted offices for their rejected reams of paper, visited brownstone streets to gather cast off telephone books when new ones were distributed.
column2: 在纽约时，他在曼哈顿街头四处搜寻被人丢弃的垃圾，在办公室里寻找被人丢弃的成堆纸张，在分发新的电话簿时走访褐沙石街道，收集被人扔掉的电话簿。

column1: And now, living in Taipei, Chen obtains his material from university libraries and bookstores, publishing companies, archeological museums, and telephone companies.
column2: 而现在，住在台北的陈先生从大学图书馆和书店、出版公司、考古博物馆以及电话公司获得自己的材料。

column1: The special quality of Chen's works is that people can still read the pages.
column2: 陈龙斌作品的特殊之处在于人们依然能翻阅这些书页。

column1: “I try to make sculptures that are appropriate for the content of the books.
column2: “我尝试制作适合书籍内容的雕塑。

column1: In my concept, the form and content is united together; the content gives me the idea of the form.
column2: 在我的理念中，形式和内容是结合在一起的；内容给了我关于形式的想法。

column1: Yellow Pages give me one kind of idea; books discarded from libraries inspire different styles…" Often, his art reflects the content of the pages within, such as one hanging installation featuring spirals of books with peepholes in which one can view a scene from the story within the original pages.
column2: 黄页给我一种想法；图书馆丢弃的书启发了不同的风格...”通常，他的艺术作品反应书页里的内容，比如一个带有窥视孔的螺旋型书籍悬挂装置，人们可以查看原书页中的故事场景。

column1: Starting from 2, the Tourism Bureau integrated civilian and local governmental resources to conduct the event to celebrate the Lantern Festival (fifteenth day of the first month in the lunar calendar) and the end of the Chinese New Year.
column2: 从 2 开始，旅游局整合民间和地方政府资源，开展活动庆祝灯节（农历正月十五）以及春节结束。

column1: The purpose of the festival is to spread the traditional folklore.
column2: 该节日的目的是传播传统民俗。

column1: It is also known as the Yuan Xiao Festival.
column2: 也称为元宵节。

column1: The firecrackers ceremony of the Wumiao temple in Yanshui District was held by ancient people, in order to show respect for the exploits of Guan Yu.
column2: 古人在盐水区的武庙举行鞭炮燃放仪式，以表对关羽功绩的尊重之情。

column1: Fengpao is the ceremony to start to burn thousands of soaring firecrackers hung on a five to twenty-five meters high wooden stand.
column2: 蜂炮作为开始仪式，点燃数千个悬挂在 5-25 米高的木架上的冲天炮。

column1: This ceremony starts from six o'clock in the afternoon until five o'clock in the morning.
column2: 这一仪式从下午六点开始，直至凌晨五点结束。

column1: Thousands of people and visitors attend the ceremony.
column2: 数以千计的百姓和游客参加这一仪式。

column1: The festival is the most important annual lantern festival in Taiwan.
column2: 该节日是台湾最为重要的年度灯会。

column1: Prior to 26, the event was held at Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Park in Taipei.
column2: 26 之前，活动在台北的中正纪念公园举行。

column1: Since 2001, the event has toured Taiwan.
column2: 自 2001 年以来，该活动在台湾巡回举行。

column1: The American Discovery Channel's program "Fantastic Festivals of the World" has highlighted the Taiwan Lantern Festival as one of the best festivals in the world.
column2: 美国的探索频道节目《世界最佳节庆》将台湾灯会列为世界最佳节庆之一。

column1: Taiwanese people write their wishes on the lanterns with a belief to bring an abundant crop.
column2: 台湾人把自己的愿望写在灯笼上，相信能带来丰收。

column1: Women wish for a new son to earn more hands to work.
column2: 妇女希望能生一个儿子，以增加干活的人手。

column1: These lanterns fly to the sky, bring their wishes to the Gods, and alternatively speak all dreams them that being blessed with luck and good things.
column2: 这些灯笼飞向天空，把他们的愿望带给神灵，或者说所有人都梦想着被神保佑，能有好运和好事。

column1: The theme of the main lanterns often corresponds with the zodiac signs of Chinese astrology.
column2: 主灯的主题往往与中国十二生肖相一致。

column1: All of them are over ten meters tall.
column2: 它们均超过 10 米高。

column1: Since 123, every main lantern has its own theme music which is about 3 days in length and plays the rhythm when making performances during Taiwan Lantern Festival.
column2: 自 123 开始，每盏主灯都有自己的主题音乐，大约 3 天，在台湾灯会期间进行表演时奏乐。

column1: The smaller lanterns, often carried by children or placed on temples, show images of historical figures, birds, or images from that year's theme.
column2: 小一些的灯笼通常由儿童提着或摆在寺庙上，展示历史人物、鸟类、或当年主题的图像。

column1: As early as the late Qing dynasty, many vendors were already selling beef slices served cold in the streets of Chengdu, using beef offal because they were relatively inexpensive.
column2: 早在清朝末年，许多小贩已在成都街头售卖牛肉片冷盘，因为牛下水价格相对便宜，所以用其制作冷盘。

column1: Because of its low cost, the dish was popular among rickshaw pullers and poor students.
column2: 由于成本低，这道菜很受人力车夫和穷学生欢迎。

column1: In the 1930s, a married couple in Chengdu became famous for making beef slices.
column2: 20 世纪 30 年代，成都有一对夫妻因制作牛肉片而出名。

column1: The husband, Guo Zhaohua (郭朝華), and wife, Zhang Tianzheng (張田政), were particular about the beef slices they made, and often experimented with new ingredients.
column2: 丈夫郭朝华和妻子张田政对他们制作的牛肉片非常讲究，经常尝试新的原料。

column1: As a result, their beef slices had a distinct taste from the other beef slice vendors, and their business boomed.
column2: 因此，他们的牛肉片与其他牛肉片商家的味道截然不同，生意也随之兴隆。

column1: Often though, mischievous children would pull a prank on the couple, and stick paper notes that read fuqi feipian ("husband and wife lung pieces") on their backs, and sometimes people would yell the words out.
column2: 但调皮的孩子们常常捉弄这对夫妻，往他们背上贴上写有“夫妻肺片”字样的纸条，有时人们会大声念这些字。

column1: Later on, a merchant tried the fuqi feipian and was so satisfied, he gave them a gold-lettered plaque that read fuqi feipian, and the name has stuck ever since.
column2: 后来一位商人尝了夫妻肺片，非常满意，送给他们一块写着“夫妻肺片”的金字牌匾，从此这个名称就流传至今。

column1: To suit their customers' tastes, the couple made many improvements on the dish, and offal slices were eventually replaced by various beef or lamb slices.
column2: 为了适应顾客的口味，这对夫妻对这道菜做了许多改进，内脏薄片最终被各种牛肉片或羊肉片所取代。

column1: Many people still preferred calling the dish fuqi feipian, thus the name is still used today.
column2: 许多人仍然喜欢把这道菜称为“夫妻肺片”，因此这个名称至今依然在使用。

column1: The meaning of fei was originally waste parts or offal (廢) but later changed to lung (肺) so the dish sounded less repulsive.
column2: “废”的意思是废物或内脏，但后来改为“肺”，因此这道菜听起来不那么令人厌恶。

column1: The lung could be a part of this offal, but fei is not lung by itself in this dish's meaning.
column2: 肺可以作为内脏的一部分，但在这道菜中并不是指“肺”。

column1: In September 1988, during the 20th anniversary celebration of Evergreen Marine Corporation's founding, company chairman Chang Yung-fa announced his company's intentions to establish Taiwan's first private international airline.
column2: 1988 年 9 月，在庆祝长荣海运股份有限公司成立 20 周年期间，公司董事长张荣发宣布公司有意成立台湾第一家私营国际航空公司。

column1: The opportunity to create a major Taiwanese airline had just arisen following a decision by the Taiwanese government to liberalise the country's air transportation system.
column2: 在台湾当局决定放开该地区航空运输系统之后，创立一家大型台湾航空公司的机会已经来临。

column1: Government requirements still mandated global experience and financial capital requirements for any company seeking permission to initiate international airline service from Taiwan.
column2: 对于试图获准在台湾开创国际航空服务的任何公司而言，具备全球经验以及财务资本要求仍是当局的强制要求。

column1: Upon receipt of regulatory approval, EVA Airways Corporation was formally established in March 1989.
column2: 一获得监管批准，长荣航空股份有限公司便于 1989 年 3 月正式成立。

column1: The airline was originally to be called Evergreen Airways, however this was deemed too similar to the unrelated Evergreen International cargo airline.
column2: 这家航空公司最初取名为 Evergreen Airways，但这一名称被认为与另一家不相关的航空货运公司 Evergreen International 过于相似。

column1: In October 1989, the newly formed EVA Airways Corporation placed a US$3.6 billion order for 26 aircraft from Boeing and McDonnell Douglas, including Boeing 747-400 and MD-11 airliners.
column2: 1989 年，新成立的长荣航空出手 36 亿美元，从波音公司和麦道公司订购了 26 架飞机，其中包括波音 747-400 和麦道 MD-11 飞机。

column1: Operations began on 1 July 1991 with a small fleet of Boeing 767-300ER aircraft featuring business and economy class seating.
column2: 一支小规模的波音 767-300ER 机队于 1991 年 7 月 1 日开始运营，主打商务舱和经济舱。

column1: Initial destinations from Taipei were Bangkok, Seoul, Jakarta, Singapore, and Kuala Lumpur.
column2: 从台北起飞的目的地最初为曼谷、首尔、雅加达、新加坡和吉隆坡。

column1: By the end of the year, the EVA Air network had expanded to include additional cities in East Asia and its first European destination, Vienna.
column2: 到那年底，长荣航空的网络已拓展到涵盖东亚其他城市和首个欧洲目的地——维也纳。

column1: First year revenues reached US$40 million.
column2: 第一年营收达 4000 万美元。

column1: In 1992, EVA Air received the first of its Boeing 747-400 aircraft on order, and launched its premium economy class, "Economy Deluxe", on its 747 transpacific flights to Los Angeles, beginning in December of that year.
column2: 1992 年，长荣航空拿到订购的第一架波音 747-400 飞机，从这年 12 月开始，在其飞往洛杉矶的 747 跨太平洋航班上推出了该公司的高级经济舱“豪华经济舱”。

column1: EVA Air's premium economy cabin was the first in the world featured a wider 2-4-2 abreast configuration, legrests, individual seatback video, and enhanced meal services.
column2: 长荣航空的高级经济舱是全球首创，有更宽敞的 2-4-2 并排座位、脚凳、个人椅背影音系统和升级版餐饮服务。

column1: EVA Air's Economy Deluxe cabin (later renamed "Evergreen Deluxe" and "Elite Class") proved popular with the traveling public.
column2: 事实证明，长荣航空的豪华经济舱（后改名为“长荣客舱”和“菁英舱”）广受旅客欢迎。

column1: For international services, EVA Air's 747s were configured with 104 premium economy seats as part of a 370-seat, four-class cabin, in addition to first, business and economy classes.
column2: 在国际服务方面，长荣航空的 747 飞机有 104 个高级经济舱座位，全机共有 370 个座位，分为四个舱段，其余为头等舱、商务舱和经济舱。

column1: In 1993, EVA Air added flights to Seattle, New York, Bangkok and Vienna with the Boeing 747-400.
column2: 1993 年，长荣航空增加了至西雅图、纽约、曼谷和维也纳的航班，由波音 747-400 飞机执飞。

column1: By 1994, EVA Air was providing regular service to 22 destinations worldwide, and carrying over 3 million passengers annually.
column2: 到 1994 年，长荣航空提供飞往全球 22 个目的地的定期服务，每年运送 300 多万乘客。

column1: In 1995, the airline posted its first profit on revenues of US$1.05 billion, one year ahead of schedule.
column2: 1995 年，该航空公司公布其首次利润，营收 10.5 亿美元，比计划提前了一年。

column1: Internationally, EVA Air's rapid expansion and increased passenger volume was boosted by its safety record, in contrast to its primary competitor, China Airlines.
column2: 在国际业务方面，与主要竞争者中华航空相比，长荣航空因其良好的安全记录而得到迅速扩张，客运量不断增加。

column1: In addition to receiving IOSA (IATA Operational Safety Audit) certification, EVA Air in 1997 achieved simultaneous official ISO 9002 certification in the areas of Passenger, Cargo, and Maintenance Services.
column2: 除了获得国际航空运输协会运营安全审计（IOSA）认证之外，1997 年长荣航空在客运、货运和维修服务领域同时取得 ISO 9002 正式认证。

column1: Dedicated EVA Air Cargo operations began in April 1995, with the first weekly McDonnell Douglas MD-11 freighter flights to Taipei, Singapore, Penang, San Francisco, New York, and Los Angeles.
column2: 专门的长荣航空货运业务始于 1995 年 4 月，麦道 MD-11 货运航班首次每周飞往台北、新加坡、槟城、旧金山、纽约和洛杉矶。

column1: EVA Air Cargo's fleet was expanded to five freighters by the end of the year.
column2: 到这一年底，长荣航空货运机队扩大到五架货机。

column1: Previously, EVA Air Cargo operations mainly relied on passenger aircraft cargo space.
column2: 此前，长荣航空货运业务主要依靠客机的货舱空间。

column1: In the mid–1990s, EVA Air expanded into the domestic Taiwan market by acquiring shares in Makung International Airlines, followed by Great China Airlines and Taiwan Airways.
column2: 20 世纪 90 年代中期，长荣航空相继入股马公航空、大华航空和台湾航空，进军台湾本土市场。

column1: On 1 July 1998, all three carriers, as well as EVA's existing domestic operations, merged under the UNI Air title.
column2: 1998 年 7 月 1 日，这三家航空公司外加长荣已有的本土业务合并至立荣航空名下。

column1: UNI Air became EVA Air's domestic intra-Taiwanese subsidiary, operating short haul flights out of its base in Kaohsiung, Taiwan's southern port and second-largest city.
column2: 立荣航空成为长荣航空在台湾境内的子公司，以台湾南部港口及第二大城市高雄作为基地，运营短途航班。

column1: In 2000, EVA Air embarked on its first major long-haul fleet renewal.
column2: 2000 年，长荣航空进行该公司首次大型长途机队更新。

column1: The airline became one of the launch customers for the Boeing 777-300ER, ordering four aircraft plus eight options.
column2: 这家航空公司成为波音 777-300ER 的首营客户之一，订购了四架飞机和八架飞机的选购权。

column1: At the same time, the airline placed three orders for the Boeing 777-200LR.
column2: 与此同时，该航空公司还签订了三份波音 777-200LR 订单。

column1: In January 2001, EVA Air ordered its first Airbus aircraft, the A330-200.
column2: 2001 年 1 月，长荣航空订购了该公司首架空客 A330-200 飞机。

column1: The Boeing 777 aircraft were intended for United States and European services, while the Airbus A330 aircraft were intended for regional Asian routes.
column2: 波音 777 飞机用于服务美国和欧洲业务，而空客 A330 飞机则用于亚洲地区航线。

column1: In 2001, EVA Air began listing public stock offerings on the Taiwan Stock Exchange.
column2: 2001 年，长荣航空在台湾证券交易所公开发行股票上市。

column1: Initially, one percent of the company's shares was offered over-the-counter, with one-quarter held by parent company Evergreen Marine Corporation and EVA Air employees, respectively.
column2: 最初，该公司百分之一的股份在场外发售，其中四分之一的股份由母公司长荣海运股份有限公司和长荣航空员工分别持有。

column1: In 2002, EVA Air underwent internal corporate reforms, with staff reductions and streamlined management.
column2: 2002 年，长荣航空进行企业内部改革，削减人员，精简管理。

column1: This culminated a process which had begun in 1997, when the Asian financial crisis began affecting profitability.
column2: 此举把始于 1997 年的过程推向高潮，当时亚洲金融风暴开始影响利润率。

column1: The 2002–2003 SARS contagion also affected passenger traffic for medium-haul flights in Southeast Asia, while long-haul flights to North America, Japan, and Europe were less affected.
column2: 2002-2003 年非典疫情也影响了东南亚的中程航班客流量，而飞往北美、日本和欧洲的长程航班受影响较小。

column1: In 2004, EVA Air converted its remaining eight options for Boeing 777-300ERs into firm orders.
column2: 2004 年，长荣航空将该公司剩余的八架波音 777-300ER 选购权转为确认订单。

column1: The first Boeing 777-300ER entered service as EVA Air's new flagship aircraft in July 2005.
column2: 首架波音 777-300ER 作为长荣航空的新旗舰飞机于 2005年 7 月投入使用。

column1: With the arrival of its new Boeing 777s, EVA Air launched a comprehensive revamp of its cabins, introducing lie-flat seats in its new Premium Laurel business class cabin, and upgrading its premium economy product to the new Elite Class cabin.
column2: 波音 777 系列新飞机到货后，长荣航空对其客舱进行了全面改造，在新的桂冠商务舱中推出平躺式座椅，并将其高级经济舱产品升级为全新的菁英舱。

column1: The airline's A330s were introduced with two-class Premium Laurel and Economy cabins.
column2: 该航司的 A330 飞机推出了桂冠舱和经济舱两个舱位。

column1: In December 2005, EVA Air and its associated divisions had 5,098 employees, and the airline's network spanned 40 passenger destinations worldwide, with additional cargo destinations.
column2: 2005 年 12 月，长荣航空及其关联部门共有 5098 名员工，航司网络遍及全球 40 个客运目的地，以及其他货运目的地。

column1: In 2007, EVA Air announced a nonstop Taipei to New York (John F. Kennedy International Airport) service, to be operated with its new long-range Boeing 777-300ERs.
column2: 2007 年，长荣航空宣布推出台北至纽约（肯尼迪国际机场）直飞服务，将由其最新的波音 777-300ER 执飞。

column1: At the same time, the airline withdrew passenger service from Taipei to Paris.
column2: 同时，该公司取消了台北至巴黎的客运服务。

column1: On 31 October 2008, EVA Air announced a resumption of Taipei to Paris service with twice-weekly passenger flights beginning 21 January 2009.
column2: 2008 年 10 月 31 日，长荣航空宣布恢复台北至巴黎的服务，从 2009 年 1 月 21 日起每周两趟客运航班。

column1: In 2008, the airline also announced the suspension of services to Auckland.
column2: 2008 年，该公司还宣布停飞奥克兰。

column1: The carrier also prepared to increase direct flights to China, after initiating weekly charter flights in July 2008 following changes to the Three Links travel agreements.
column2: 在“三通”协议修改后，2008 年 7 月启动了每周包机航班，该航空公司还准备增加飞往大陆的直飞航班。

column1: For the 2007–2008 period, EVA Air coped with a 34% surge in fuel prices, which contributed to a US$61.2 million 2007 loss.
column2: 2007-2008 年间，长荣航空应对燃油价格暴涨 34%，导致 2007 年亏损 6120 万美元。

column1: In August 2008, EVA Air reported a second quarterly loss due to increased fuel costs.
column2: 由于燃油成本上涨，2008 年 8 月，长荣航空第二次报告季度亏损。

column1: In response, the airline implemented cost-saving measures, including flight schedule reductions and fee increases.
column2: 作为回应，航司实施成本节约措施，包括减少航班计划和增加费用。

column1: In early 2008, EVA Air's business office in El Segundo, California, announced a major staff reduction, with over half the staff advised that they would no longer be employed by May 2008.
column2: 2008 年初，长荣航空位于加州埃尔塞贡多的办事处宣布大幅裁员，一半以上的员工表示到 2008 年 5 月将不再被雇用。

column1: Functions performed by those local staff were shifted to Taiwan by half, such as the reservation center.
column2: 由这些当地员工负责的职能有一半被转移到台湾，例如预定中心。

column1: EVA Air carried 6.2 million passengers in 2007, and employed 4,800 staff members as of April 2008. The carrier returned to profitability in the first quarter of 2009, with a US$5.9 million net gain.
column2: 2007 年，长荣航空运送 620 万旅客，截至 2008 年 4 月共有 4800 名员工。该公司 2009 年一季度重新恢复盈利，净收益 590 万美元。

column1: In August 2010, EVA Air was named one of the top 10 international airlines in Travel+Leisure's World's Best Awards.
column2: 2010 年 8 月，长荣航空在《漫旅 Travel Leisure》杂志世界最佳奖项中被评为十佳国际航空公司之一。

column1: In March 2010, EVA Air began services to Toronto.
column2: 2010 年 3 月，长荣航空开通至多伦多的航线。

column1: In November 2010, EVA Air began nonstop flights connecting the inner-city Taipei Songshan and Tokyo Haneda airports.
column2: 2010 年 11 月，长荣航空开通市内台北松山机场至东京羽田机场的直飞航班。

column1: In 2010, Chang Kuo-wei, son of Chang Yung-fa, returned to serve as EVA Air's president, and the carrier recorded increased sales and yearly profits.
column2: 2010 年，张荣发之子张国炜回国，担任长荣航空总裁，该公司实现销售额和年利润增长。

column1: In early 2011, the carrier announced that it had applied for airline alliance membership with Star Alliance, and later that year clarified that it was in talks to join either Oneworld or Star Alliance by 2013.
column2: 2011 年初，该公司宣布已向星空联盟申请航空联盟成员资格，并于当年晚些时候澄清，表示该公司正就 2013 年之前加入“寰宇一家”或星空联盟开展谈判。

column1: In June 2011, the carrier began nonstop flights from Taipei to Guam, and in October 2011 the carrier announced nonstop service from New York (JFK) to Taipei.
column2: 2011 年 6 月，该公司开通台北至关岛的直飞航班，2011 年 10 月该公司宣布推出纽约（肯尼迪机场）至台北的直飞服务。

column1: On 27 March 2012, EVA Air announced that it would join Star Alliance in 2013.
column2: 2012 年 3 月 27 日，长荣航空宣布该公司将于 2013 年加入星空联盟。

column1: On 24 September 2012 EVA Air signed a partnership with Amadeus IT Group Altéa suite for its Altéa Revenue Management system.
column2: 2012 年 9 月 24 日，长荣航空就 Altéa 收入管理系统与艾玛迪斯 IT 集团签署 Altéa 全套解决方案合作协议。

column1: On 18 June 2013, EVA Air became a full member of Star Alliance.
column2: 2013 年 6 月 18 日，长荣航空成为星空联盟正式会员。

column1: In October 2014, EVA AIR announced its intention to expand its North American network by adding new routes to Houston in 2015 and Chicago in 2016, along with expanding 55 flights per week to 63 flights per week to North America.
column2: 2014 年 10 月，长荣航空宣布有意扩大其北美网络，在 2015 年新增至休斯顿、2016 年新增至芝加哥的航线，此外将飞往北美的航班从每周 55 班次增加到每周 63 班次。

column1: In October 2015, EVA AIR announced its intent to purchase up to 24 Boeing 787 Dreamliners and two additional 777-300ER (Extended Range) jetliners from Boeing.
column2: 2015 年 10 月，长荣航空宣布有意从波音公司购买多达 24 架波音 787 梦想客机外加两架 777-300ER（增程）喷气客机。

column1: EVA Airways will join the 787-10 launch customer team.
column2: 长荣航空将成为 787-10 机型的首营客户之一。

column1: In November 2015, EVA Air unveiled a new livery on its 22nd Boeing 777-300ER.
column2: 2015 年 11 月，长荣航空在其第 22 架波音 777-300ER 上公布了全新涂装。

column1: In January 2016, Evergreen Group chairman Chang Yung-fa died, leaving control of the company to his son by his second marriage, Chang Kuo-Wei.
column2: 2016 年 1 月，长荣集团董事长张荣发去世，将公司控制权交给其第二任妻子所生之子张国炜。

column1: In March 2016, a coup by the three children of Chang Yung-fa's first marriage removed Chang Kuo-Wei as chairman and replaced him with Lin Pang-Shui (Steven Lin).
column2: 2016 年 3 月，张荣发原配的三名子女发动人事突变，解除了张国炜的董事长职务，由林宝水（Steven Lin）接任。

column1: Chang Kuo-Wei later established a new airline separate from EVA Air, called StarLux Airlines.
column2: 张国炜之后成立了一家独立于长荣航空的新航空公司，名为星宇航空。

column1: In June 2016, EVA Air was one of eleven airlines to be given a Skytrax 5-star rating, along with All Nippon Airways, Asiana Airlines, Cathay Pacific, Etihad Airways, Garuda Indonesia, Hainan Airlines, Japan Airlines, Lufthansa, Qatar Airways and Singapore Airlines.
column2: 2016 年 6 月，长荣航空成为获得 Skytrax 五星评级的十一家航空公司之一，其余十家为全日空航空、韩亚航空、国泰航空、阿提哈德航空、印尼鹰航、海南航空、日本航空、汉莎航空、卡塔尔航空和新加坡航空。

column1: On 24 August 2017, EVA Air unveiled its third-generation uniform, designed by fashion house Shiatzy Chen.
column2: 2017 年 8 月 24 日，长荣航空公布了由时装品牌夏姿·陈设计的第三代制服。

column1: Those new uniforms were rolled out in November 2017, replacing the second generation uniform that was introduced in 2003.
column2: 这些新制服于 2017 年 11 月推出，用以取代 2003 年推出的第二代制服。

column1: On 2 October 2018, EVA Air took delivery of its first of four Boeing 787-9 Dreamliners.
column2: 2018 年 10 月 2 日，长荣航空收到所订购的四架波音 787-9 梦想客机中的第一架。

column1: The airline has orders for 20 787-10s and options for six more.
column2: 该航空公司订购了 20 架波音 787-10，还拥有对另外六架飞机的选购权。

column1: In June 2019, EVA Air took delivery of its first of twenty Boeing 787-10 Dreamliners.
column2: 2019 年 6 月，长荣航空收到所订购二十架波音 787-10 梦想客机的第一架飞机。

column1: On 20 June 2019, Taiwan Flight Attendants Union (TFAU) started an air strike.
column2: 2019 年 6 月 20 日，台湾空服员职业工会（TFAU）开始航空罢工。

column1: EVA Air and Taiwan Flight Attendants reached an agreement on 7 July 2019 stating that the strike will end on 10 July 2019.
column2: 长荣航空与台湾空服员职业工会于 2019 年 7 月 7 日达成协议，声明罢工将于 2019 年 7 月 10 日结束。

column1: About 1440 flights are cancelled and more than 280,000 passengers are affected from the air strike.
column2: 约有 1440 趟航班取消，逾 28 万旅客受到此次航空罢工影响。

column1: The strike lasted from 20 June 2019 to 10 July 2019 which lasted from 17 days, the longest strike in Taiwan history.
column2: 该罢工从 2019 年 6 月 20 日至 2019 年 7 月 10 日，持续 17 天，为台湾历史上最长罢工。

column1: The airline estimates a prospective loss of about US$97 million as a result of the strike.
column2: 航空公司估计因罢工造成的预计亏损约为 9700 万美元。

column1: As of 2011, EVA Air's corporate leadership is headed by Chairman Lin Bou-shiu and President Cheng Chuan-yi.
column2: 截至 2011 年，长荣航空企业领导层由董事长林宝水和总裁郑传义领导。

column1: EVA Air's president plays a primary role in managing EVA's business operations.
column2: 长荣航空的总裁在管理长荣航空的业务运营方面发挥主要作用。

column1: Other members of EVA Air's board manage support and service services of the company, including its catering and maintenance divisions.
column2: 长荣航空董事会其他成员管理、支持并服务于公司的服务，其中包括餐饮部门和维修部门。

column1: Related areas outside EVA Air's direct management include UNI Holidays, Evergreen's Evasión travel service and Evergreen Laurel Hotels.
column2: 不归长荣航空直接管理的相关领域包括立荣假期、长荣集团的 Evasión 旅游服务和长荣桂冠酒店。

column1: EVA Air has its headquarters, known as the EVA Air Building, in Luzhu, Taoyuan City.
column2: 长荣航空的总部，人称长荣航空大厦，位于桃园市芦竹区。

column1: EVA Air is largely privately owned.
column2: 长荣航空主要为私人所有。

column1: Primary shareholders are Evergreen Marine Corporation (20%), Evergreen founder Chang Yung-fa (15%), and Evergreen International Corporation (11%).
column2: 主要股东为长荣海运股份有限公司（20%）、长荣创始人张荣发（15%）和长荣国际股份有限公司（11%）。

column1: Foreign investors and individual stockholders combined hold 28% of EVA Air shares.
column2: 外国投资者和个人股东合计持有长荣航空 28% 的股份。

column1: EVA Air has differentiated its onboard service by using Taiwanese (Hokkien), Mandarin, Hakka, English, and other languages for its in-flight cabin announcements.
column2: 长荣航空使用台湾话（闽南语）、国语、客家话、英语和其他语言进行机舱广播，实现差异化的机上服务。

column1: The order of Hokkien and Mandarin has varied since the carrier's launch.
column2: 自该航空公司启动后，闽南语和普通话的顺序发生了变化。

column1: EVA Air has also used Taiwanese folk songs in its boarding music, including an orchestral form of "Longing for Spring Wind" performed by the Evergreen Group's Evergreen Symphony Orchestra.
column2: 长荣航空还在登机音乐中使用台湾民谣，其中包括由长荣集团长荣交响乐团演奏的管弦乐版《望春风》。

column1: The carrier's aircraft and employee color scheme has at times been interpreted by observers as support for the Pan-Green Coalition of Taiwanese politics, mainly due to Evergreen founder Chang Yung-fa's political views in the 2000 presidential election, but this association changed following Chang's support of the Pan-Blue Coalition in the 2004 presidential election.
column2: 该航空公司的飞机涂装和员工配色方案有时被观察家解读为支持台湾政坛泛绿联盟，主要是由于长荣创始人张荣发在 2000 年台湾地区领导人选举时所持的政治观点，但 2004 年台湾地区领导人选举时张荣发支持泛蓝联盟，这一关联从而发生改变。

column1: The carrier has further abstained from displaying official markings of Taiwan on its aircraft, and received expedited approval of international landing rights as a result.
column2: 该航空公司还进一步避免在其飞机上展示台湾的官方标志，因此快速获得了国际着陆权的批准。

column1: The name "EVA" was taken from two letters of "Evergreen" and the first letter of "Airways." The name "EVA" is always spelled in capital letters and is pronounced "E-V-A".
column2: 名称“EVA”来自单词“Evergreen”的前两个字母和“Airways”的首字母。“EVA”这个名称始终大写，发音为“E-V-A”。

column1: The airline uses the logo of its parent company, using green with an orange trim.
column2: 航空公司使用其母公司的标识，采用带橙色装饰的绿色。

column1: The standard EVA Air livery utilizes dark green, signifying durability, and orange, representing technological innovation.
column2: 标准的长荣航空涂装采用深绿色，代表持久性，而橙色代表技术创新。

column1: The tail globe logo is intended to represent stability and reliability, and its positioning on the tail, with one corner off the edge, represents service innovation.
column2: 尾翼上的地球仪标志旨在代表稳定性和可靠性，位于尾部，边缘缺一个角，代表服务创新。

column1: The EVA Air livery was updated in 2002, adding a larger typeface and the use of green covering the aircraft below the window line.
column2: 长荣航空的涂装于 2002 年进行更新，增加了更大的字体，舷窗线以下的机身涂成绿色。

column1: The tail design and logo remained unchanged.
column2: 机尾设计和标志保持不变。

column1: In late 2015, EVA Air redesigned the livery and tail logo, using the dark green color on the belly, and cancelled the orange line on the edge of the tail to highlight the corporate identity.
column2: 2015 年末，长荣航空对涂装和机尾标志进行重新设计，机身腹部采用深绿色，取消了机尾边缘的橙色线条以突出企业形象。

column1: Since 2003, EVA Air has adopted its current uniform, featuring dark green dresses with cropped jackets.
column2: 自 2003 年以来，长荣航空采用目前的制服，以深绿色连裙装配短夹克为特色。

column1: Chief pursers are distinguished by orange highlights, gold bands, and orange stripes; flight attendants feature green trim and white stripes.
column2: 主任乘务长以橙色高光、金色饰带和橙色线条进行区分；空乘人员以绿色饰边和白色线条为特点。

column1: The name Pingtung refers to a former nearby mountain known as Half-Screen Mountain (Chinese: 半屏山; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Pòaⁿ-pêng-soaⁿ).
column2: 屏东这一名称指的是附近曾有的一座山，称为半屏山。

column1: Pingtung means "East of Half-Screen Mountain."
column2: 屏东的意思是“半屏山以东”。

column1: After two incidents in which Dutch sailors were killed by the aboriginal inhabitants of Liuqiu Island, in Spring 1636, a punitive campaign was carried out by Dutch sailors which became known as the Lamey Island Massacre.
column2: 发生两起荷兰水手被琉球岛原住民杀害的事件后，1636 年春，荷兰水手展开惩罚性行动，史称“拉米岛大屠杀”。

column1: Modern-day Pingtung County and Kaohsiung City were part of Banlian-chiu (萬年州; Bān-liân-chiu) during the Kingdom of Tungning (1661–1683) and Fongshan Prefecture (鳳山縣; Hōng-soaⁿ-koān) during Qing dynasty rule (1683–1895).
column2: 今天的屏东县和高雄市在东宁省时期（1661-1683 年）曾隶属万年州，在清朝统治时期（1683-1895 年）属于凤山县。

column1: Pingtung County is a recently developed county.
column2: 屏东县是最近才发展起来的一个县。

column1: Its largest city is Pingtung City.
column2: 最大的城市为屏东市。

column1: Until the seventeenth century, this area of Taiwan was a place of exile for Chinese criminals and occasional landing point for international mariners.
column2: 直到十七世纪，台湾的这一地区都是中国罪犯的流放之地，偶尔也有国际海员在此登陆。

column1: Only the settlements near present-day Checheng Township existed.
column2: 只有今天车城乡附近的定居点还存在。

column1: In 1664, the Hakka settlers arrived from mainland China and farmed under a homesteading system introduced by Zheng Jing.
column2: 1664 年，客家定居者从中国大陆来到这里，在郑经推行的家园体系下耕作。

column1: Pingtung City, the biggest city in Pingtung County, also known as "A-Kau" (阿猴; A-kâu), was the home of Taiwanese Plains Aborigines.
column2: 屏东县最大的城市屏东市，也称为“阿猴”，是台湾平埔族原住民的故乡。

column1: In their language, "A-kau" means "the forest".
column2: 在他们的语言中，“阿猴”意为“森林”。

column1: The first settlements by Han Chinese people were not established until 1684 with the creation of villages near Pingtung by people from China's southern Fujian region.
column2: 汉族人的第一个定居点直到 1684 年才建立，由来自中国南方福建地区的人在屏东附近建立村庄。

column1: By 1734 most of the Pingtung Plain was cultivated and in 1764 Pingtung was expanded.
column2: 到 1734 年，屏东平原的大部分地区都已被开垦，1764 年屏东扩张。

column1: In 1836, the government and locals worked together to build the four walls of the city (the North gate, the East gate, the West gate and the South gate), and the roads were also properly finished.
column2: 1836 年，政府与当地人合力修建了这座城市的四道城墙（北门、东门、西门和南门），道路也得到妥善修整。

column1: In March 1867, 14 American sailors were killed near Kenting by local aborigines in the Rover Incident, which lead to the American Formosa Expedition three months later.
column2: 1867 年 3 月，在“罗孚事件”中，14 名美国水手在垦丁附近被当地原住民所杀，导致三个月后发生美国福尔摩沙远征。

column1: In 1871, 54 sailors from Ryukyu were killed by local aborigines in the Mudan Incident.
column2: 1871 年，在八瑶湾事件中，54 名来自琉球的水手命丧当地原住民之手。

column1: The Japanese carried out a punitive campaign against the local aborigines in the Japanese invasion of Taiwan (1874).
column2: 日本人在入侵台湾时（1874年）对当地原住民进行了惩罚性报复。

column1: Under Japanese rule (1895–1945), Hōzan Subprefecture (Japanese: 鳳山支廳) was initially under Tainan Ken (臺南縣), but political divisions changed frequently between 1895 and 1901.
column2: 在日据时期（1895-1945 年），凤山支厅最初隶属台南县，但在 1895 年至 1901 年，政治划分频繁变动。

column1: In 1901, Akō Chō (阿猴廳) was established.
column2: 1901 年，建立阿猴厅。

column1: In 1909, the name was modified to Akō Chō (阿緱廳).
column2: 1909 年，名称改为阿缑厅。

column1: In 1920, the name was changed to Heitō City (屏東市) and was administered under Takao Prefecture, which consisted of modern-day Pingtung County and Kaohsiung.
column2: 1920 年，改名为屏东市，归高雄州管辖，后者由今天的屏东县和高雄组成。

column1: After the handover of Taiwan from Japan to the Republic of China on 25 October 1945, the area of present-day Pingtung County was incorporated to Kaohsiung County on 25 December 1945.
column2: 日本于 1945 年 10 月 25 日将台湾归还中华民国之后，现在的屏东县地区于 1945 年 12 月 25 日被并入高雄县。

column1: On 16 August 1950, Pingtung County was established after being separated from Kaohsiung County.
column2: 1950 年 8 月 16 日，从高雄县分离后，屏东县建立。

column1: On 1 December 1951, Pingtung City was downgraded from provincial city to county-controlled city and county seat of Pingtung County.
column2: 1951 年 12 月 1 日，屏东市从省辖市降格为县辖市和屏东县县城。

column1: Pingtung was the site of an 7.1 magnitude earthquake on 26 December 2006.
column2: 2006 年 12 月 26 日，屏东当地发生 7.1 级地震。

column1: In 2009, Pingtung received rainfall in excess of 2,500 millimetres (98 in); breaking all rainfall records of any single place in Taiwan induced by a single typhoon.
column2: 2009 年，屏东降雨超 2500 毫米（98 英寸）；打破台湾任一地方由单个台风引发的所有降雨记录。

column1: With a land area of over 2,775 km² (1,071 sq mi), Pingtung is the fifth largest county in Taiwan, the second largest of Southern Taiwan after Kaohsiung City. Geographically it borders Kaohsiung City to the north, Taitung County to the east, the Taiwan Strait to the west and the Bashi Channel to the south.
column2: 屏东土地面积逾 2775 平方公里（1071 平方英里），是台湾第五大县，台湾南部第二大，仅次于高雄市。在地理上，它北接高雄市，东面与台东县相邻，西临台湾海峡，南毗巴士海峡。

column1: Islands administered by the county include Hsiao Liuchiu (Lamay Islet; 琉球嶼) and Qixingyan (Seven Star Reefs; 七星岩).
column2: 该县管辖的岛屿包括小琉球屿和七星岩。

column1: Pingtung City is the county seat of Pingtung County which houses the Pingtung County Government and Pingtung County Council.
column2: 屏东市是屏东县县城，设有屏东县政府和屏东县议会。

column1: The county is headed by Magistrate Pan Men-an of the Democratic Progressive Party.
column2: 该县由民进党人潘孟安县长领导。

column1: Pingtung County elected three Democratic Progressive Party legislators to the Legislative Yuan during the 2016 legislative election.
column2: 在 2016 年立法选举中，屏东县选出三名民进党立法委员进入立法院。

column1: As of 2015, Pingtung County has the third highest number of registered temples at 1,101 after Tainan and Kaohsiung.
column2: 截至 2015 年，屏东县注册寺庙数量位居第三，有 1101 间，仅次于台南和高雄。

column1: The economy of Pingtung County has been traditionally dominated by agriculture and fishery industries.
column2: 屏东县的经济传统上以农业和渔业为重。

column1: However, the Pingtung County Government has been greatly promoting the tourism sector of the county in recent years.
column2: 但近年来，屏东县政府一直大力推动该县的旅游业。

column1: Currently, tourism sector in the county contributes to 30% of the tourism industry in Taiwan.
column2: 目前，该县旅游业对台湾旅游行业贡献达 30%。

column1: In February 2014, the county government announced a plan to develop an industrial center which consists of a service center, workshop and performance venue.
column2: 2014 年 2 月，县政府宣布计划开发一个由服务中心、工作坊和表演场所组成的产业中心。

column1: This was aimed to promote the development of industries that leverage the unique cultural attributes of the Linali tribe.
column2: 此举旨在促进利用礼纳里部落独特文化属性的产业发展。

column1: On 22 September 2015, the National Development Council revealed a three-year large-scale development plan to boost the economy of the county by transforming Dapeng Bay, Donggang Township and Lamay Island into a fishery, recreational and tourism hub.
column2: 2015 年 9 月 22 日，“国家发展委员会”透露了一项为期三年的大规模开发计划，通过把大鹏湾、东港镇和小琉球改造成渔业、休闲和旅游中心，振兴该县经济。

column1: Pingtung County houses Taiwan's third nuclear power plant, the Maanshan Nuclear Power Plant.
column2: 屏东县拥有台湾第三座核电站，马鞍山核电厂。

column1: The power plant is located in Hengchun Township and is Taiwan's second largest nuclear power plant in terms of its capacity at 2 X 890 MW.
column2: 电厂坐落于恒春镇，容量为 2 X 890 兆瓦，是台湾第二大容量核电厂。

column1: The Pingtung Line and South-Link Line of the Taiwan Railways Administration lines cross Pingtung County, consist of Central Signal, Chaozhou, Donghai, Fangliao, Fangshan, Fangye Signal, Guilai, Jiadong, Jialu, Kanding, Linbian, Linluo, Liukuaicuo, Nanzhou, Neishi, Pingtung, Xishi, Zhen'an and Zhutian Station.
column2: 台湾铁路管理局的屏东线和南回线穿过屏东县，由中央信号站、潮州站、东海站、枋寮站、枋山站、枋野站、归来站、佳冬站、加禄站、崁顶站、林边站、麟洛站、六块厝站、南州站、内狮站、屏东站、西势站、镇安站和竹田站组成。

column1: The Pingtung Line links Pingtung County with Kaohsiung City, while the South-Link Line links Pingtung County with Taitung County.
column2: 屏东线连接屏东县和高雄市，而南回线连接屏东县和台东县。

column1: Ferry service is operated between Donggang Township and Baisha Port and Dafu Port on the offshore Lamay Island.
column2: 东港镇与近海小琉球的白沙港和大福港之间有轮渡服务。

column1: Hoklo immigrants to the area during the 16th and 17th centuries called the region Takau (Chinese: 打狗; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Tá-káu).
column2: 在16 世纪和 17 世纪移民到这一地区的河洛人把这里称为“打狗”。

column1: The surface meaning of the associated Chinese characters was "beat the dog".
column2: 相关汉字的字面意思是“打狗”。

column1: According to one theory, the name Takau originates from the aboriginal Siraya language and translates as "bamboo forest".
column2: 一种理论称，“打狗”这个称呼源自原住民西拉雅语，翻译过来就是“竹林”。

column1: According to another theory, the name evolved via metathesis from the name of the Makatao tribe, who inhabited the area at the time of European and Hoklo settlement.
column2: 另一种理论则称，这一称呼从马卡道族部落的名称演变而来，这个部落在欧洲人和河洛人定居期间居住于此。

column1: The Makatao are considered to be part of the Siraya tribe.
column2: 马卡道被认为是西拉雅部落的一部分。

column1: During the Dutch colonization of southern Taiwan, the area was known as Tancoia to the western world for a period of about three decades.
column2: 在荷兰人殖民台湾南部期间，这一地区被西方世界称为 Tancoia 约三十年。

column1: In 1662, the Dutch were expelled by the Kingdom of Tungning, founded by Ming loyalists of Koxinga.
column2: 1662 年，荷兰人被忠于明朝的郑成功所创建的东宁省驱逐。

column1: His son, Zheng Jing, renamed the village Banlian-chiu (Chinese: 萬年州; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Bān-liân-chiu; literally: 'ten-thousand-year region (zhou)') in 1664.
column2: 他的儿子郑经于 1664 年将该村改名万年州。

column1: The name of "Takau" was restored in the late 1670s, when the town expanded drastically with immigrants from mainland China, and was kept through Taiwan's cession to the Japanese Empire in 1895.
column2: 17 世纪 70 年代末，来自中国大陆的移民大量涌入，该镇急剧扩张，“打狗”这一称呼得以恢复，并一直保留到 1895 年台湾割让给日本帝国时。

column1: In his 1903 general history of Taiwan, US Consul to Formosa James W. Davidson relates that "Takow" was already a well-known name in English.
column2: 美国驻福尔摩沙领事达飞声在其 1903 年台湾通史中提到，“打狗”在英语中已是一个众所周知的名称。

column1: In 1920, the name was changed to Takao (Japanese: 高雄, after Takao (Kyoto)) and administered the area under Takao Prefecture.
column2: 1920  年，改名为高雄（日语：高雄，源自京都高雄），由高雄州管辖。

column1: While the new name had quite a different surface meaning, its pronunciation in Japanese sounded more or less the same as the old name spoken in Hokkien.
column2: 虽然新名称的字面意思颇为不同，但其发音在日语中与用闽南语称呼的旧称听起来差不多。

column1: After Taiwan was handed to the Republic of China, the name did not change, but the official romanization became "Kaohsiung" (pinyin: Gāoxióng) after the Standard Chinese pronunciation of 高雄.
column2: 台湾交还中华民国之后，名称未改，但官方罗马拼法按高雄的标准国语发音改为“Kaohsiung”（拼音：Gāoxióng）。

column1: The name Takau remains the official name of the city in Austronesian languages of Taiwan such as Rukai, although these are not widely spoken in the city.
column2: 在鲁凯语等台湾南岛语系中，“Takau”这一称呼仍是该市的正式名称，但这些语言在该市并不广泛使用。

column1: The name also remains popular locally in the naming of businesses, associations, and events.
column2: 这个名称在企业、协会和活动的命名中依然广受当地人欢迎。

column1: The written history of Kaohsiung can be traced back to the early 17th century, through archaeological studies have found signs of human activity in the region from as long as 7,000 years ago.
column2: 高雄有记载的历史可以追溯到 17 世纪初，通过考古研究，发现该地区早在 7000 年前就有人类活动的迹象。

column1: Prior to the 17th century, the region was inhabited by the Makatao people of the Siraya tribe, who settled on what they named Takau Isle (translated to 打狗嶼 by Ming Chinese explorers); "Takau" meaning "bamboo forest" in the aboriginal language.
column2: 17 世纪以前，该地区居住着西拉雅部落的马卡道人，他们定居在被其取名为塔考屿（被中国明代探险家翻译为打狗屿）的地方；“Takau”在原住民语言中意为“竹林”。

column1: The earliest evidence of human activity in the Kaohsiung area dates back to roughly 4,700–5,200 years ago.
column2: 高雄地区最早的人类活动证据可追溯至大约 4700-5200 年前。

column1: Most of the discovered remnants were located in the hills surrounding Kaohsiung Harbor.
column2: 发现的绝大多数遗迹都位于高雄港周围的山丘上。

column1: Artifacts were found at Shoushan, Longquan Temple, Taoziyuan, Zuoying, Houjing, Fudingjin and Fengbitou.
column2: 在寿山、龙泉寺、桃子园、左营、后劲、覆鼎金和凤鼻头都发现了文物。

column1: The prehistoric Dapenkeng, Niuchouzi, Dahu, and Niaosong civilizations were known to inhabit the region.
column2: 据了解，史前的大坌坑、牛稠子、大湖和鸟松文明均居住在这一地区。

column1: Studies of the prehistoric ruins at Longquan Temple have shown that that civilization occurred at roughly the same times as the beginnings of the aboriginal Makatao civilization, suggesting a possible origin for the latter.
column2: 对龙泉寺史前遗迹的研究已表明，该文明存在时与原住民马卡道文明的开始时间大致相同，表明可能是后者的起源。

column1: Unlike some other archaeological sites in the area, the Longquan Temple ruins are relatively well preserved.
column2: 不同于该地区其他一些考古遗址，龙泉寺遗址保存得相对较好。

column1: Prehistoric artifacts discovered have suggested that the ancient Kaohsiung Harbor was originally a lagoon, with early civilizations functioning primarily as hunter-gatherer societies.
column2: 已发现的史前文物表明，古代高雄港原本是一个泻湖，早期文明主要以狩猎采集社会的方式运作。

column1: Some agricultural tools have also been discovered, suggesting that some agricultural activity was also present.
column2: 还发现了一些农业用具，表明当时也存在一些农业活动。

column1: The first Chinese records of the region were written in 1603 by Chen Di, a member of Ming admiral Shen You-rong's expedition to rid the waters around Taiwan and Penghu of pirates.
column2: 对这一地区的第一批中文记载由陈第在 1603 年撰写，他是明朝将领沈有容率队远征台湾和澎湖一带水域清剿海盗时的一名随从。

column1: In his report on the "Eastern Barbarian Lands" (Dong Fan Ji), Chen Di referred to a Ta-kau Isle:
column2: 在他的报告《东番记》中，陈第提到了一个打狗屿：

column1: It is unknown when the barbarians (Taiwanese aborigines) arose on this island in the ocean beyond Penghu, but they are present at Keeong Harbor (nowaday's Budai, Chiayi), the bay of Galaw (Anping, Tainan), Laydwawan (Tainan City), Yaw Harbor (Cheting, Kaohsiung), Takau Isle (Kaohsiung City), Little Tamsui (Donggang, Pingtung), Siangkeykaw (Puzi, Chiayi), Gali forest (Jiali District, Tainan), the village of Sabah (Tamsui, Taipei), and Dwabangkang (Bali, New Taipei City).
column2: 东番夷人（台湾原住民）不知所自始，居彭湖外洋海岛中。起魍港（今嘉义布袋）、加老湾（台南安平），历大员（台南市）、尧港（高雄茄定）、打狗屿（高雄市）、小淡水（屏东东港）、双溪口（嘉义朴子）、加哩林（台南佳里区）、沙巴里（台北淡水）和大帮坑（新北市八里），皆其居也。

column1: Taiwan became a Dutch colony in 1624, after the Dutch East India Company was ejected from Penghu by Ming forces.
column2: 荷兰东印度公司被明朝军队逐出澎湖后，台湾于 1624 年成为荷兰殖民地。

column1: At the time, Takau was already one of the most important fishing ports in southern Taiwan.
column2: 当时，高雄已是台湾南部最重要的渔港之一。

column1: The Dutch named the place Tankoya, and the harbor Tancoia.
column2: 荷兰人把这里取名为坦科亚（Tankoya），把港口命名为坦科亚（Tancoia）。

column1: The Dutch missionary François Valentijn named Takau Mountain "Ape Berg", a name that would find its way onto European navigational charts well into the 18th century.
column2: 荷兰传教士法伦泰因把高雄山取名为“猿山”（Ape Berg），这一名称直到 18 世纪仍出现在欧洲的航海图上。

column1: Tankoia was located north of Ape's Hill and a few hours south from Tayouan (modern-day Anping, Tainan) by sail.
column2: 坦科亚位于猿山以北，从台窝湾（今台南安平）向南行船数小时可达。

column1: At the time, a wide shallow bay existed there, sufficient for small vessels.
column2: 当时，那里有一个宽阔的浅水湾，足以容纳小型船只。

column1: However, constant silting changed the coastline.
column2: 但不断的淤积改变了海岸线。

column1: During this time, Taiwan was divided into five administrative districts, with Takau belonging to the southernmost district.
column2: 在此期间，台湾划分成五个行政区，打狗归属最南端的区。

column1: In 1630, the first large scale immigration of Han Chinese to Taiwan began due to famine in Fujian, with merchants and traders from China seeking to purchase hunting licenses from the Dutch or hide out in aboriginal villages to escape authorities in China.
column2: 1630 年，由于福建饥荒，汉族人开始第一次大规模迁往台湾，从中国来的商人和贸易商试图从荷兰人手中购买狩猎许可证，或躲在原住民村落内以躲避中国政府。

column1: In 1684, the Qing dynasty annexed Taiwan and renamed the town Fengshan County (Chinese: 鳳山縣; pinyin: Fèngshān Xiàn), considering it a part of Taiwan Prefecture.
column2: 1684 年，清朝收回台湾，并将该镇改名为凤山县，将其作为台湾州的一部分。

column1: It was first opened as a port during the 1680s and subsequently prospered fairly for generations.
column2: 17 世纪 80 年代，这里首次被开辟为港口，随后繁荣数代。

column1: In 1895, Taiwan was ceded to Japan as part of the Treaty of Shimonoseki.
column2: 1895 年，作为《马关条约》的一部分，台湾被割让给日本。

column1: Administrative control of the city was moved from New Fongshan Castle to the Fongshan Sub-District of Tainan Chō (臺南廳).
column2: 该市的行政管理从新凤山城移至台南厅凤山支厅。

column1: In November 1901, twenty chō were established in total; Hōzan Chō (鳳山廳) was established nearby.
column2: 1901 年 11 月，共设立二十个厅；凤山厅建在附近。

column1: In 1909, Hōzan Chō was abolished, and Takow was merged into Tainan Chō.
column2: 1909 年，凤山厅被废除，打狗并入台南厅。

column1: In 1920, during the tenure of 8th Governor-General Den Kenjirō, districts were abolished in favor of prefectures.
column2: 1920 年，在第八任总督田健治郎的任内，废厅设州。

column1: Thus the city was administered as Takao City (高雄市 Takao-shi) under Takao Prefecture.
column2: 因此，该市作为高雄市归高雄州管辖。

column1: The Japanese developed Takao, especially the harbor that became the foundation of Kaohsiung to be a port city.
column2: 日本人对高雄进行开发，尤其是开发令高雄成为港口城市之基础的港口。

column1: Takao was then systematically modernized and connected to the end of North-South Railway.
column2: 随后，高雄得到系统的现代化发展，与南北铁路的终点相连。

column1: Kaohsiung Harbor was also developed starting from 1894. The city center was relocated several times during the period due to the government's development strategy.
column2: 高雄港也从 1894 年开始开发。在此期间，由于政府的发展战略，城市中心多次搬迁。

column1: Development was initially centered on Ki-au (Chinese: 旗後; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Kî-āu) region but the government began laying railways, upgrading the harbor, and passing new urban plans.
column2: 开发最初集中在旗后地区，但政府开始铺设铁路，改造港口，并通过了新的城市规划。

column1: New industries such as refinery, machinery, shipbuilding and cementing were also introduced.
column2: 还引进了炼油、机械、造船和水泥等新的产业。

column1: Before and during World War II it handled a growing share of Taiwan's agricultural exports to Japan, and was also a major base for Japan's campaigns in Southeast Asia and the Pacific.
column2: 二战之前及二战期间，该市承担了台湾对日农业出口日益增多的份额，也是日本在东南亚和太平洋地区作战的主要基地。

column1: Extremely ambitious plans for the construction of a massive modern port were drawn up.
column2: 制定了极其雄心勃勃的计划，要建设一个大型现代港口。

column1: Toward the end of the war, the Japanese promoted some industrial development at Kaohsiung, establishing an aluminum industry based on the abundant hydroelectric power produced by the Sun Moon Lake project in the mountains.
column2: 至战争结束时，日本人在高雄推动了一部分工业发展，借助山里的日月潭项目所产生的丰沛水电，建立了铝业。

column1: The city was heavily bombed by Task Force 38 and FEAF during World War II between 1944-1945.
column2: 二战期间，在 1944-1945 年间，该市遭第 38 特遣舰队和远东空军猛烈轰炸。

column1: After control of Taiwan was handed over from Japan to the government of the Republic of China on 25 October 1945, Kaohsiung City and Kaohsiung County were established as a provincial city and a county of Taiwan Province respectively on 25 December 1945.
column2: 1945 年 10 月 25 日，日本将台湾统治权归还中国民国政府，之后，高雄市和高雄县分别作为台湾省的省辖市和县于 1945 年 12 月 25 日成立。

column1: The official romanization of the name came to be "Kaohsiung", based on the Wade–Giles romanization of the Mandarin reading of the kanji name.
column2: 根据汉字名称普通话读法的威妥玛拼音，名称的官方罗马拼写变为“Kaohsiung”。

column1: Kaohsiung City then consisted of 10 districts, which were Gushan, Lianya (renamed "Lingya" in 1952), Nanzi, Cianjin, Cianzhen, Cijin, Sanmin, Sinsing, Yancheng, and Zuoying.
column2: 当时高雄市分为 10 个区，分别是鼓山、连雅（1952 年改名“苓雅”）、楠梓、前金、前镇、旗津、三民、新兴、盐埕和左营。

column1: During this time, Kaohsiung developed rapidly.
column2: 在这一时期，高雄快速发展。

column1: The port, badly damaged in World War II, was restored.
column2: 二战期间遭严重毁坏的港口得到恢复。

column1: It also became a fishing port for boats sailing to Philippine and Indonesian waters.
column2: 也成为向菲律宾和印度尼西亚海域出海的船只的一座渔港。

column1: Largely because of its climate, Kaohsiung overtook Keelung as Taiwan's major port.
column2: 主要由于其气候，高雄超过基隆成为台湾主要港口。

column1: Kaohsiung also surpassed Tainan to become the second largest city of Taiwan in the late 1970s and Kaohsiung City was upgraded from a provincial city to special municipality on 1 July 1979, by the Executive Yuan with a total of 11 districts.
column2: 20 世纪 70年代末，高雄还超过台南成为台湾第二大城市，1979 年 7 月 1 日，高雄市由省辖市升为“行政院”直辖的特别市，共有 11 个区。

column1: The additional district is Siaogang District, which was annexed from Siaogang Township of Kaohsiung County.
column2: 新增了从高雄县小港乡并入的小港区。

column1: The Kaohsiung Incident, where the government suppressed a commemoration of International Human Rights Day, occurred on December 10, 1979.
column2: 1979 年 12 月 10 日发生“美丽岛事件”，当时政府对国际人权日纪念活动进行镇压。

column1: Since then, Kaohsiung gradually grew into a political center of the Pan-Green population of Taiwan, in opposition to Taipei where the majority population is Kuomintang supporters.
column2: 从那以后，高雄逐渐成为台湾泛绿阵营的政治中心，与国民党支持者占多数人口的台北相对立。

column1: On December 25, 2010, Kaohsiung City merged with Kaohsiung County to form a larger special municipality with Lingya District and Fengshan District becoming the capital city, ending the administration of Kaohsiung County.
column2: 2010 年 12 月 25 日，高雄市与高雄县合并成为更大的直辖市，苓雅区和凤山区成为首府，取消高雄县治。

column1: On 31 July 2014, a series of gas explosions occurred in the Cianzhen and Lingya Districts of the city, killing 31 and injuring more than 300.
column2: 2014 年 7 月 31 日，该市前镇区和苓雅区发生一系列燃气爆炸事故，造成 31 人死亡，300 多人受伤。

column1: Five roads were destroyed in an area of nearly 20 square kilometres (7.7 square miles) near the city center.
column2: 在该市中心附近近 20 平方公里（7.7 平方英里）范围内，有五条道路受损。

column1: It was the largest gas explosion in Taiwan's modern history.
column2: 这是台湾现代历史上规模最大的燃气爆炸。

column1: The city sits on the southwestern coast of Taiwan facing the Taiwan Strait, bordering Tainan City to the north, Chiayi and Nantou County to the northwest, Taitung County to its northeast and Pingtung County to the south and southeast.
column2: 该市坐落于台湾西南海岸，面朝台湾海峡，北接台南市，西南方为嘉义和南投县，东北方为台东县，南方及东南方为屏东县。

column1: The downtown areas are centered on Kaohsiung Harbor with Cijin Island on the other side of the harbor acting as a natural breakwater.
column2: 闹市区以高雄港为中心，旗津岛位于港湾另一边，起到天然防波堤的作用。

column1: The Love River (Ai River) flows into the harbor through the Old City and downtown.
column2: 爱河流经老城和闹市区，流入港口。

column1: Zuoying Military Harbor lies to the north of Kaohsiung Harbor and the city center.
column2: 左营军港位于高雄港和市中心以北。

column1: Kaohsiung's natural landmarks include Ape Hill and Mount Banping.
column2: 高雄的天然地标有寿山和半屏山。

column1: As in most Taiwanese cities or counties, the majority of the population are Han Taiwanese.
column2: 与台湾大多数市县一样，大多数人口为台湾汉族。

column1: The Hans are then divided into 3 subgroups, Hoklo, Hakka, and Waishengren.
column2: 汉族进而被分为三个子群，即福佬、客家人和外省人。

column1: The Hoklo and Waishengren mostly live in flatland townships and the city centre, while the majority of the Hakka population live in the suburbs or rural townships of the northeastern hills.
column2: 福佬和外省人大多生活在平原乡镇和市中心，而大部分客家人则居住在郊区或东北部山地的农村乡镇。

column1: The Taiwanese aborigines of Kaohsiung, who belong to various ethnic groups that speak different languages belonging to the Austronesian language family similar/related to those of Maritime Southeast Asia and Oceania, mostly live in the mountain townships such as Taoyuan or Namasia.
column2: 高雄的台湾原住民属于不同族群，说着同属于南岛语系的不同语言（这些语言与东南亚沿海和大洋洲的语言相似/相关），大多生活在桃园或那玛夏等山区乡镇。

column1: The main aboriginal groups living within the city center include the Bunun, Rukai, Tsou and the Kanakanavus.
column2: 居住在市中心的主要原住民群体包括布农族、鲁凯族、邹族和堪卡那福族。

column1: As of December 2010, Kaohsiung city hosts around 21,000 foreign spouses.
column2: 截至 2010 年 12 月，高雄市容纳了约 21000 名外籍配偶。

column1: Around 12,353 are Mainland Chinese, 4,244 are Vietnamese, around 800 Japanese and Indonesians and around 4,000 other Asians or foreigners from Europe or the Americas.
column2: 约有 12353 人为中国大陆人，4244 人为越南人，约 800 日本人和印度尼西亚人，以及约 4000 名亚洲其他地区的人或来自欧洲或美洲的外国人。

column1: As of April 2013, Kaohsiung hosts 35,074 foreign workers who mainly work as factory workers or foreign maids (not including foreign specialists such as teachers and other professionals).
column2: 截至 2013 年 4 月，高雄拥有 35074 名外籍劳工，主要为工厂工人或外籍女佣（不包括教师和其他专业人士等外国专家）。

column1: Within around half of which are Indonesians, and the other half being workers from other Southeast Asian countries mainly from Vietnam, the Philippines or Thailand.
column2: 其中约有一半为印尼人，另一半为来自其他东南亚国家的劳工，主要来自越南、菲律宾或泰国。

column1: Kaohsiung is a major international port and industrial city in the southwest of Taiwan.
column2: 高雄是台湾西南部的主要国际港口和工业城市。

column1: As an exporting center, Kaohsiung serves the agricultural interior of southern Taiwan, as well as the mountains of the southeast.
column2: 作为出口中心，高雄服务于台湾南部的农业腹地和东南部山区。

column1: Major raw material exports include rice, sugar, bananas, pineapples, peanuts (groundnuts) and citrus fruits.
column2: 主要原材料出口包括大米、糖、香蕉、菠萝、花生（落花生）和柑橘类水果。

column1: The 2,200-hectare (5,400-acre) Linhai Industrial Park, on the waterfront, was completed in the mid-1970s and includes a steel mill, shipyard, petrochemical complex, and other industries.
column2: 海滨占地 2200 公顷（5400 英亩）的临海工业园建成于 20 世纪 70年代中期，包括一家钢铁厂、造船厂、石化综合体和其他工业。

column1: The city has an oil refinery, aluminum and cement works, fertilizer factories, sugar refineries, brick and tile works, canning factories, salt-manufacturing factories, and papermaking plants.
column2: 该市有一家炼油厂、数家铝厂和水泥厂、化肥厂、炼糖厂、砖瓦厂、罐头厂、制盐厂和造纸厂。

column1: Designated an export-processing zone in the late 1970s, Kaohsiung also attracted foreign investment to process locally purchased raw materials for export.
column2: 高雄在 20 世纪 70 年代末被指定为出口加工区，也吸引了外国投资以把在当地购买的原材料加工之后出口。

column1: The ongoing Nansing Project is a plan to reclaim 250 hectares (620 acres) of land along the coast by 2011.
column2: 正在进行的南兴计划是到 2011 年完成 250 公顷（620 英亩）的一项沿海造陆计划。

column1: The Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau plans to buy 49 hectares of the reclaimed land to establish a solar energy industrial district that would be in the harbor's free trade zone.
column2: 高雄港务局计划购买 49 公顷填海土地，用于建造一个位于港口自由贸易区内的太阳能产业区。

column1: The gross domestic product (GDP) in nominal terms of Kaohsiung City is estimated to be around US$45 billion, and US$90 billion for the metropolitan region.
column2: 高雄市的名义国民生产总值（GDP）预计约为 450 亿美元，大都市地区为 900 亿美元。

column1: As of 2008, the GDP per capita in nominal terms was approximately US$24,000.
column2: 截至 2008 年，人均名义 GDP 约为 24000 美元。

column1: Despite early success and heavy governmental investment, the city suffers from the economic north–south divide in Taiwan, which continues to be the centre of political debate.
column2: 尽管早期取得了成功，获得政府大量投资，该市也饱受台湾南北分化之苦，依然是政治辩论的中心。

column1: There has been public aims to shift the local economy towards tourism and cultural industries, with projects such as Pier-2 Art Center, National Kaohsiung Center for the Arts and Kaohsiung Music Center.
column2: 依靠驳二艺术特区、国立高雄艺术中心和高雄流行音乐中心等项目，将地方经济转向旅游业和文化产业已成为公众目标。

column1: The main agricultural produce in Kaohsiung are vegetables, fruits and rice with a total arable land of 473 km², which accounts to 16% of the total area of the municipality.
column2: 高雄市的主要农产品为蔬菜、水果和水稻，总耕地面积为 473 平方公里，占该市总面积的 16%。

column1: Kaohsiung has the highest production of guava, jujube and lychee in Taiwan.
column2: 高雄的番石榴、枣和荔枝产量为台湾最高。

column1: The main animal husbandry are chicken, dairy cattle, deer, duck, goose, pigs and sheep.
column2: 主要畜牧业为鸡、奶牛、鹿、鸭、鹅、猪和绵羊。

column1: The total annual agricultural outcome in Kaohsiung is NT$24.15 billion.
column2: 高雄的年农业产出总额为 241.5 亿新台币。

column1: Main landmarks of Kaohsiung city include the 85 Sky Tower, the ferris wheel of the Kaohsiung Dream Mall, the Kaohsiung Arena and Kaohsiung Harbor.
column2: 高雄市的主要地标包括 85 大楼、高雄梦时代购物中心摩天轮、高雄巨蛋和高雄港。

column1: The Beijing railway station's predecessor was the Zhengyangmen railway station, also called the Beijing station, which was located 2.5 km (1.6 mi) due west, just outside Zhengyangmen (also known as Qianmen), a gate in the city wall directly south of Tiananmen Square.
column2: 北京火车站的前身是正阳门火车站，也叫北京站，位于正阳门（也叫前门）外正西 2.5 公里（1.6 英里）处，正阳门是天安门广场正南的城门。

column1: The Zhengyangmen railway station was built in 1901 and served as the terminus of the Kaiping Tramway and Imperial Railways of North China, also known as the Beijing–Shanhaiguan Railway until 1959 when the station closed after the opening of the current Beijing railway station and has become part of the China Railway Museum.
column2: 正阳门火车站建于 1901 年，是开平有轨电车和华北帝国铁路的终点站，也被称为北京-山海关铁路，直至 1959 年现在的北京火车站启用后才关闭，成为中国铁路博物馆的一部分。

column1: To commemorate the Tenth Anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China in 1958 began the planning and construction of ten large-scale projects, known as the "Ten Great Buildings" to showcase the new outlook of the country and the Beijing railway station was amongst the projects undertaken.
column2: 为纪念中华人民共和国成立十周年，中共中央于 1958 年开始规划建设十个大型项目，被称为“十大建筑”，以展示国家焕然一新的面貌，北京火车站就是其中之一。

column1: In late October 1958, according to the early 1950 Beijing municipal government's construction and planning records, the design arrangements for the new railway station was commenced.
column2: 1958 年 10 月下旬，根据 1950 年初北京市政府的建设规划，开始了新火车站的设计安排。

column1: The station's design was assigned to the Ministry of Railway Institute's third department (now the Third Railway Survey and Design Institute Group Co.
column2: 站场的设计交给铁道部第三设计院（现铁道第三勘察设计院集团有限

column1: Ltd) with the station house building chaired by then renowned architects Yang Tingbao (杨廷宝) and Chen Deng'ao (陈登鏊), the National Building and Industry Department and the Nanjing Institute of Architectural Design were to cooperate in the design tasks.
column2: 公司），在当时的著名建筑师杨廷宝和陈登鳌的主持下，国家建工部与南京市建筑设计研究院合作完成了站房的设计任务。

column1: The station's design progressed rapidly and by early December the same year, the whole design proposal was completed.
column2: 车站设计进度迅速，同年12月上旬完成全部设计方案。

column1: On December 10, the design proposal was approved by the Central Committee.
column2: 12月10日，设计方案获得中央批准。

column1: The then Premier Zhou Enlai was also very concerned about the design and construction of the new Beijing railway station, and dealt with aspects concerning the direction and positioning of station names to the layout of the VIP room environment.
column2: 时任国务院总理周恩来也非常关心北京站的设计建造工作，从站名的方向位置到贵宾室的环境布置，都曾过问

column1: In determining the design program proposal, Zhou Enlai proposed that turrets be built on each of the two wings of the main building and this suggestion was adopted.
column2: 在审定设计方案时，周恩来提出在主楼两翼各增加一座角楼的建议也得到采纳。

column1: On January 20, 1959 the construction of the new station commenced with the number of construction workers reaching up to two million people during the peak stage and project investment amounted to 57.82 million yuan.
column2: 1959 年 1 月 20 日，新车站正式动工建设，施工人员最多时达两万余人，项目投资 5782 万元人民币。

column1: Soviet experts were also hired to give technical guidance at the construction sites.
column2: 也聘请了苏联专家在施工现场给予技术指导。

column1: In just over seven months, the project was completed on September 10, 1959.
column2: 仅仅七个月多月后，该项目就于 1959 年 9 月 10 日竣工。

column1: The new Beijing railway station covered an area of two hundred and fifty thousand square meters, the Station House Building site covered an area of 46,700 square meters, the station plaza comprised an area of forty thousand square meters.
column2: 新北京火车站占地面积 25 万平方米，站房大楼占地 46700 平方米，站前广场面积 4 万平方米。

column1: Chairman Mao Zedong wrote the calligraphic characters in the station sign.
column2: 毛泽东主席为车站题写了站名。

column1: The Beijing railway station was one of the largest construction projects in mainland China during that time with modern facilities and it was also China's first large modern railway terminal.
column2: 北京火车站是当时中国大陆规模最大的建设项目之一，拥有现代化设施，也是中国首个大型现代火车站。

column1: At the time of completion, the station has a twelve tracks and six railway platforms with canopies attached to them.
column2: 竣工时，该站有 12 条铁轨，6 座带顶棚的铁路站台。

column1: The Station house building faced south and the architecture included both a Chinese traditional style and the Soviet Stalinist architecture。The twelve passenger waiting rooms comprised a total area of fourteen thousand square meters and was able to accommodate 14,000 waiting passengers.
column2: 站房大楼坐北朝南，该建筑既富有中国传统风格，又是苏联斯大林式建筑。12 个旅客候车室总面积达 1.4 万平方米，可容纳 14000 名候车旅客。

column1: The inner complex of the Main Station Building contained a passenger waiting room, mother and child waiting room, movie theater, recreation hall, visitors' restaurants, post office, clinic and other facilities.
column2: 主站房大楼的内部建筑群包括旅客候车室、母婴候车室、电影院、娱乐厅、游客餐厅、邮局、诊所和其他设施。

column1: Installed on the roof of the Station House were two marble clock faces and every morning from 7am to 9pm the bell sounded punctually and "The East Is Red song is played out.
column2: 安装在车站大楼屋顶上的是两个大理石钟面，每天早上 7 点至晚上 9 点，钟声准点响起，播放歌曲《东方红》。

column1: The Beijing station equipment was considered to be relatively advanced at its -time with four AC2-59 type escalators installed in the interior; the joint design and production of the escalators were coordinated by the Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Shanghai Elevator Company. The four sets of escalators were replaced during the 1980 and again during 1990; the most recent replacement of the elevators occurred in early2005 - the design being a product of Otis Company.
column2: 北京站的设备在当时算是比较先进的，内部安装了 4 台AC2-59 型自动扶梯；自动扶梯由上海交通大学和上海电梯公司协调完成设计与生产。这四台自动扶梯在 1980 年和 1990 年期间进行了更换；最近一次更换电梯于 2005 年初进行——选用了奥的斯公司设计的产品。

column1: In pre-Han times (i.e., before 206 BC), the site of the city of Shiyi in the state of Zhao was located in this area, and from Han (206 BC–AD 220) to Sui (581–618) times it was the site of a county seat with the same name.
column2: 汉代以前（即公元前 206 年之前），赵国的石邑城就位于这一地区，从汉代（公元前 206 年-公元 220 年）到隋代（581-618 年），这里是座同名县城的所在地。

column1: With the reorganization of local government in the early period of the Tang dynasty (618–907), the county was abolished.
column2: 随着唐朝初期（618-907 年）进行地方政府重组，该县被废除。
