column1: The name "Shijiazhuang" was first mentioned in 1535 on a stele of a local temple.
column2: 1535 年，在当地一座寺庙的一块石碑上，首次出现“石家庄”这一名称。

column1: Shijiazhuang was then little more than a local market town, subordinated to the flourishing city of Zhengding a few miles to the north.
column2: 当时石家庄只不过是一个地方集镇，隶属于北面数英里开外的繁荣城市正定。

column1: The growth of Shijiazhuang into one of China's major cities began in 1905, when the Beijing–Wuhan (Hankou) railway reached the area, stimulating trade and encouraging local farmers to grow cash crops.
column2: 石家庄发展成为中国主要城市之一始于1905年，当时北京-武汉（汉口）铁路开通至该地区，刺激了贸易，鼓励当地农民种植经济作物。

column1: Two years later the town became the junction for the new Shitai line, running from Shijiazhuang to Taiyuan, Shanxi.
column2: 两年后，该镇成为石家庄至山西太原的全新的石太线上的枢纽。

column1: The connection transformed the town from a local collecting centre and market into a communications centre of national importance on the main route from Beijing and Tianjin to Shanxi, and later, when the railway from Taiyuan was extended to the southwest, to Shaanxi as well.
column2: 这一连接将该镇从一个当地的集散中心和市场，转变为在京津至山西的主干道上、以及后来铁路从太原延伸至西南及陕西时，具有全国重要性的交流中心。

column1: The city also became the centre of an extensive road network.
column2: 这座城市也成为四通八达的公路网的中心。

column1: Pre-World War II Shijiazhuang was a large railway town as well as a commercial and collecting centre for Shanxi and regions farther west and for agricultural produce of the North China Plain, particularly grain, tobacco, and cotton.
column2: 二战前，对于山西和更远的西部地区以及华北平原的农产品来说，石家庄是一座大型铁路城市，也是商业与集散中心，尤其对粮食、烟草和棉花而言。

column1: By 1935 it had far outstripped Zhengding as an economic centre.
column2: 到 1935 年，作为经济中心，它的作用已经远胜于正定。

column1: At the end of World War II the character of the city changed when it took on an administrative role as the preeminent city in western Hebei, and developed into an industrial city.
column2: 二战结束时，这座城市的特色发生了变化，当时该市作为河北省西部的杰出城市，开始承担行政功能，并发展成一座工业城市。

column1: Some industries, such as match manufacturing, tobacco processing, and glassmaking, had already been established before the war.
column2: 一些工业在战前就已建立，例如火柴制造、烟草加工和玻璃制造等。

column1: On November 12, 1947, the city was captured by Communist forces.
column2: 1947 年 11 月 12 日，人民解放军攻占该市。

column1: In 1948 the city, formerly known as Shímén (石門), was renamed Shijiazhuang.
column2: 1948 年，这座原名为“石门”的城市，改名为石家庄。

column1: Xibaipo, a village about 90 km (56 mi) from downtown Shijiazhuang, in Pingshan County was the location of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the headquarters of the People's Liberation Army during the decisive stages of the Chinese Civil War between May 26, 1948 and March 23, 1949, at which point they were moved to Beijing.
column2: 西柏坡是距石家庄市区约 90 公里（56 英里）的平山县的一个村， 1948 年 5 月 26 日至 1949 年 3 月 23 日，在中国内战的决定性阶段。这里是中共中央和人民解放军司令部所在地，后迁往北京。

column1: Today, the area is a memorial site.
column2: 今天，该地区已成为纪念地。

column1: After 1949 the industrialisation of the city gathered momentum.
column2: 1949年之后，该市工业化发展势头强劲。

column1: Its population more than tripled in the decade 1948–58.
column2: 1948-58 年的十年间，其人口增加了两倍多。

column1: In the 1950s, the city experienced a major expansion in the textile industry, with large-scale cotton spinning, weaving, printing, and dyeing works.
column2: 20 世纪 50 年代，该市经历了纺织业大扩张，出现了大型棉纺、织布和印染厂。

column1: In addition there are plants processing local farm produce.
column2: 除此之外，还有当地农产品加工厂。

column1: In the 1960s it was the site of a new chemical industry, with plants producing fertilizer and caustic soda.
column2: 20 世纪 60 年代，它成为新的化学工业基地，建有化肥和苛性钠生产厂。

column1: Shijiazhuang also became an engineering base, with a tractor-accessory plant.
column2: 石家庄也成为了工程基地，建有一家拖拉机配件厂。

column1: There are important coal deposits at Jingxing and Huailu, now named Luquan, a few miles to the west in the foothills of the Taihang Mountains, which provide fuel for a thermal-generating plant supplying power to local industries.
column2: 太行山麓以西数英里处，在井陉和获鹿（现名“鹿泉”）有重要的煤炭矿藏，为一家给当地工业供电的热电厂提供燃料。

column1: In 1967, Tianjin was again carved out of Hebei, remaining a separate entity today, and thus the provincial capital was moved to Baoding.
column2: 1967 年，天津再次从河北划出（至今仍为直辖市），因此省会迁至保定。

column1: It was chaotic in the midst of the Cultural Revolution, and under the direction of Mao Zedong, in 1968, to "prepare for war and natural disasters", Shijiazhuang became the provincial capital.
column2: 文化大革命期间，动荡不堪，在毛泽东的指示下，为了“备战备荒”，石家庄于 1968 年成为省会。

column1: In 2014, the GDP of Shijiazhuang reached CNY(RMB) ￥510.02 billion (about $80.45 billion in USD), an increase of 12 percent over the previous year.
column2: 2014 年，石家庄 GDP 达到 5100.2 亿元人民币（约合 804.5 亿美元），比上年增长 12%。

column1: Shijiazhuang has become a major industrial city in North China and is considered to be the economic center of Hebei province.
column2: 石家庄已成为华北地区的一座主要工业城市，被视为河北省经济中心。

column1: The city is a major base for the pharmaceutical and textile industries.
column2: 该市是制药业和纺织业的主要基地。

column1: Other sectors include machinery and chemicals, building materials, light industry and electronics.
column2: 其他行业包括机械和化工、建筑材料、轻工业以及电子。

column1: With abundant agricultural resources, Shijiazhuang has 590,000 hectares of cultivated land and is the main source of cotton, pears, dates and walnuts in Hebei province.
column2: 石家庄农业资源丰富，拥有 59 万公顷耕地，是河北省棉花、梨、枣和核桃的主产地。

column1: In 2008, total imports reached US$1.393 billion, an increase of 42.1 percent over the previous year.
column2: 2008 年进口总额达 13.93 亿美元，比上年增长 42.1%。

column1: Exports increased by 34.9 percent to US$5.596 billion.
column2: 出口增长 34.9%，达到 55.96 亿美元。

column1: 2006 World Bank reported that Shijiazhuang was spending less than RMB400 per capita on education, as opposed to Beijing (RMB1,044) and Weihai (RMB1,631).
column2: 2006 年世界银行报告称，相比于北京（1044 元人民币）和威海（1631 元人民币），石家庄人均教育支出不足 400 元人民币。

column1: The city is a centre for the dairy trade, being the headquarters of the Sanlu Group.
column2: 该市为乳制品贸易中心，是三鹿集团总部所在地。

column1: Sanlu became Shijiazhuang's largest taxpayer since it had become the largest formula seller in China for a continuous 15-year period.
column2: 自连续 15 年成为中国最大的配方奶粉销售商以来，三鹿已成为石家庄最大的纳税企业。

column1: Richard McGregor, author of The Party: The Secret World of China's Communist Rulers, said that Sanlu became "an invaluable asset for a city otherwise struggling to attract industry and investment on a par with China's premier metropolises."
column2: 《党：中国共产党统治者的秘密世界》一书作者理查德·麦克格雷戈表示，三鹿“对于一座正在努力吸引工业和投资以与中国一流大城市相媲美的城市而言，是一笔宝贵的资产”。

column1: Both the dairy trade and Sanlu were affected by the 2008 Chinese milk scandal.
column2: 乳制品贸易和三鹿均受到 2008 年中国牛奶丑闻影响。

column1: The chairman and general manager of Sanlu, and several party officials, including the vice-mayor in charge of food and agriculture, Zhang Fawang, were reportedly removed from office.
column2: 据报道，三鹿集团董事长和总经理，以及包括分管粮食和农业的副市长张发旺在内的几名党政官员，均被免职。

column1: Mayor Ji Chuntang reportedly resigned on 17 September.
column2: 据报道，市长冀纯堂于 9 月 17 日辞职。

column1: Shijiazhuang is a transportation hub at the intersection point of the Beijing–Guangzhou, Taiyuan–Dezhou, and Shuozhou–Huanghua railroads.
column2: 石家庄是交通枢纽，处在铁路京广线（北京-广州）、太德线（太原-德州）和朔黄线（朔州-黄骅港）的交汇点上。

column1: The new Shijiazhuang Railway Station (opened December 2012) has a rare distinction of being served by both the "conventional"
column2: 新的石家庄火车站（2012 年 12 月启用）有一个特点很不寻常，既经停“传统的”

column1: Beijing–Guangzhou Railway and the new Beijing–Guangzhou–Shenzhen–Hong Kong High-Speed Railway.
column2: 北京-广州铁路，新的北京-广州-深圳-香港高速铁路也经停此站。

column1: Such an arrangement is fairly uncommon on China's high-speed rail network, as typically high-speed lines are constructed to bypass city cores, where the older "conventional" train stations are.
column2: 这种安排在中国的高铁网络中相当少见，因为通常修建高铁会绕过有老式传统火车站的城市核心区。

column1: In Shijiazhuang's case, to make it possible to bring the new high-speed railway into the central city, a 5 km (3.1 mi) long railway tunnel was constructed under the city.
column2: 在石家庄这里，为了使新的高铁能进入中心城市，在该市地下修建了一条 5 公里（3.1 英里）长的铁路隧道。

column1: This is the first time a high-speed railway has been run under a Chinese city.
column2: 这是高铁首次在中国的城市地下运行。

column1: There is also a smaller Shijiazhuang North Railway Station, used by trains going west toward Taiyuan without entering Shijiazhuang's city centre.
column2: 还有一个规模较小的石家庄北站，供往西去太原的列车使用，不必再进入石家庄市中心。

column1: The city is served by many expressways, including the Shitai, Beijing–Shenzhen and Taiyuan–Cangzhou Expressways.
column2: 该市有多条高速公路，包括石太高速、北京-深圳高速和太原-沧州高速。

column1: Line 1 and Line 3 of the Shijiazhuang Metro began operation on June 26, 2017.
column2: 石家庄地铁 1 号线和 3 号线于 2017 年 6 月 26 日开始运行。

column1: Line 1 Phase 2, Line 2 Phase 1, Line 3 Phase 2 and the remaining two ends of Line 3 Phase 1 are currently under construction.
column2: 目前，1 号线二期、2 号线一期、3 号线二期和 3 号线一期其余两个终点正在建设之中。

column1: Line 1 Phase 2, Line 2 Phase 1, and the two ends of Line 3 Phase 1 will start operation in 2020.
column2: 1 号线二期、2 号线一期和 3 号线一期的两个终点将于 2020 年开始运行。

column1: There will be three metro lines extending 80.4 km (50.0 mi)under operation in Shijiazhuang by 2021 when Line 3 Phase 2 completes.
column2: 到 2021 年 3 号线二期完工时，石家庄将有三条地铁投入运行，总长 80.4 公里（50.0 英里）。

column1: The latest metro plan of Shijiazhuang includes 6 lines in total.
column2: 石家庄最新地铁规划共包括 6 条线路。

column1: The railway company is drafting a new plan of 1,000 km (620 mi)urban rail transit system incorporating metro, urban rapid commuter rail and tramways, and expects there will be 200 km (120 mi)rail transit lines under operation or construction by the end of 13th Five Year Plan (2020).
column2: 铁路公司正在起草一项涵盖地铁、城市快速通勤铁路和有轨电车的城市轨道交通系统新计划，长达 1000 公里（620 英里），预计到“十三五”计划（2020 年）末，将有 200 公里（120 英里）轨道交通线路投入运行或正在建设之中。

column1: The Shijiazhuang Zhengding International Airport is the province’s center of air transportation.
column2: 石家庄正定国际机场是该省的航空运输中心。

column1: It is about 30 kilometers northeast of the city.
column2: 它位于该市东北约 30 公里处。

column1: There are 32 domestic routes arriving at and departing from Shijiazhuang, including destinations such as Shanghai, Shenzhen and Dalian.
column2: 有 32 条国内航线抵达和离开石家庄，目的地包括上海、深圳和大连等地。

column1: The airport serves 12 international destinations including four routes to Russia.
column2: 机场为 12 个国际目的地提供服务，包括飞往俄罗斯的四条航线。

column1: The airport is being expanded and will be capable of being an alternate airport to Beijing Capital International Airport.
column2: 该机场正在扩建，将能够成为北京首都国际机场的备用机场。

column1: With the opening of the Beijing–Guangzhou High-Speed Railway at the end of 2012, the airport got its own train station, making available fast, although infrequent, train service between the airport and Shijiazhuang Railway Station, as well as other stations in the region.
column2: 随着 2012 年底京广高铁开通，机场拥有了自己的火车站，从而能在机场与石家庄火车站以及该地区其他车站之间实现快速火车服务，尽管班次不多。

column1: Most large roads in the city feature a separate cycle lane and, combined with the city being flat, make it ideal for cycling.
column2: 市内大多数道路都有单独的自行车道，再加上城市地面平坦，很适合骑行。

column1: Thousands of cyclists use the city each day and often there are more cyclists waiting at a crossroad than cars.
column2: 每天有数以千计的骑自行车的人使用这个城市，在十字路口等待的骑行者往往比汽车多。

column1: Shijiazhuang is headquarters of the 27th Group Army of the People's Liberation Army, one of the three group armies that comprise the Beijing Military Region responsible for defending China's capital.
column2: 石家庄是中国人民解放军第 27 集团军总部所在地，该集团军是北京军区的三个集团军之一，负责保卫中国首都。

column1: The city of Shijiazhuang is similar to Beijing in that all roads run from north to south and east to west, making the city easy to navigate.
column2: 石家庄市与北京相似，所有的道路都是南北向和东西向，使得这座城市非常便于导航。

column1: Many roads have cycle paths making it cyclist friendly.
column2: 许多道路都有自行车道，对骑行者十分友好。

column1: In the heart of the city is the Hebei Museum (Chinese: 河北博物馆;; pinyin: Héběi Bówùguǎn) which was refurbished in 2013 and 2014.
column2: 河北博物馆位于市中心，2013 年和 2014 年进行了翻新。

column1: It holds regular events, mostly showing traditional Chinese art and artifacts.
column2: 它定期举行活动，主要展示中国传统艺术和文物。

column1: The Yutong International Sports Centre hosts the Shijiazhuang Ever Bright football matches as well as holding pop concerts.
column2: 裕彤国际体育中心举办石家庄永昌的足球赛，还举办流行音乐会。

column1: Shijiazhuang Zoo is located on the west side of the city.
column2: 石家庄动物园位于城西。

column1: The zoo has 3,000 animals of 250 species including flamingos, golden monkeys, manchurian tigers, Indian elephants, giraffes, chimpanzees, kangaroos, seals, white tigers, springboks and pandas.
column2: 动物园有 250 种 3000 只动物，包括火烈鸟、金丝猴、东北虎、印度象、长颈鹿、黑猩猩、袋鼠、海豹、白虎、跳羚和熊猫。

column1: Near the Shijiazhuang Zoo are the Botanical Gardens (Chinese: 石家庄植物园), offering a range of exotic and native plants both to view and purchase.
column2: 在石家庄动物园附近有石家庄植物园，提供一系列的异域植物和本地植物供人观赏、选购。

column1: The Martyrs Memorial (Chinese: 烈士纪念馆) can be found in the centre of the city, commemorating the soldiers lost in war.
column2: 烈士纪念馆位于市中心，以纪念在战争中牺牲的将士。

column1: Baodu Zhai (Chinese: 抱犊寨; pinyin: Bàodúzhài), or Baodu Village, is an ancient fortified hilltop settlement located on the west side of the city, the mountain contains walks and buddhist statues.
column2: 抱犊寨也叫抱犊村，位于城市西边，是一座古代设防的山顶定居点，山上有步道和佛教塑像。

column1: Close to Baodu Zhai is Fenglong Mountain (Chinese: 封龙山) is situated 5 km (3.1 mi) outside of Shijiazhuang to the west, the mountain features walks and a large stone Buddha statue situated on top of the mountain.
column2: 离抱犊寨不远是封龙山，位于石家庄西面 5公里（3.1 英里）处，山上有步行道和山顶大型石雕佛像。

column1: Mount Cangyan (Chinese: 苍岩山; pinyin: Cāngyán Shān; literally: 'Green Cliff Mountain') is a scenic area in Jingxing County, famous for its combination of natural mountain scenery with historical man-made structures.
column2: 苍岩山（字面意思：青色悬崖山）是井陉县的一座风景区，以其天然山色与历史人文建筑相得益彰而闻名。

column1: It was featured in a scene of the Chinese movie Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.
column2: 曾作为中国电影《卧虎藏龙》中的场景。

column1: The Longxing Temple (Chinese: 隆興寺; pinyin: Lóngxīng Sì) is an ancient Buddhist monastery located just outside the city.
column2: 隆兴寺位于城外，是一座古老的佛教寺院。

column1: It has been referred to as the "First Temple south of Beijing".
column2: 被誉为“京南第一古刹”。

column1: The Anji Bridge (also known as Zhaozhou Bridge) (simplified Chinese: 安济桥; traditional Chinese: 安濟橋; pinyin: Ānjì Qiáo; literally: 'Safe crossing bridge') is the world's oldest open-spandrel stone segmental arch bridge.
column2: 安济桥（字面意思：安全渡桥）又称赵州桥，是世界上最古老的敞肩石拱桥。

column1: Credited to the design of a craftsman named Li Chun, the bridge was constructed in the years 595-605 during the Sui dynasty (581–618).
column2: 这座桥由一位名叫李春的工匠设计，建于隋朝（581-618 年）595-605 年。

column1: It is the oldest standing bridge in China.
column2: 它是中国最古老的立式桥。

column1: The Pagoda of Bailin Temple (Chinese: 从谂禅师舍利塔; pinyin: Cóngshěn Chánshī Shělìtǎ or 赵州塔; Zhàozhōu Tǎ) is an octagonal-based brick Chinese pagoda built in 1330 during the reign of Emperor Wenzong, ruler of the Mongol-led Yuan Dynasty (1271–1368).
column2: 从谂禅师舍利塔也叫赵州塔，是一座八角形中式砖塔，建于 1330 年，当时是由蒙古人统治的元朝（1271-1368 年）文宗皇帝时期。

column1: Shijiazhuang city centre contains a range of parks.
column2: 石家庄市中心有一系列公园。

column1: The largest park is found in the centre of the city known as Chang'an Park (Chinese: 长安公园), the park includes an underground shopping mall, a theatre, a museum, a lake, bars and restaurants.
column2: 最大的公园位于市中心，称为长安公园，该公园包括地下购物中心、剧院、博物馆、湖、酒吧和餐馆。

column1: Another park is found on the south east side of the city: Century Park (Chinese: 世纪公园), Century Park contains a lake in the centre with an amusement park to the north side.
column2: 另一座公园位于城市东南侧：世纪公园，世纪公园中心有一个湖，北面有一个游乐园。

column1: On the northwest side of the city is Water Park (Chinese: 水上公园）which features a large lake, amusement rides, short walks and various restaurants.
column2: 在城市西北侧的是水上公园，有一个大湖、各项游乐设施、短途步道和多家餐馆。

column1: As well as these three large parks there are smaller parks scattered across the city.
column2: 除了这三个大型公园之外，还有一些小公园遍布全城。

column1: The largest mall in the city is the Wanda shopping mall on the southeast side of the city along with the Lerthai shopping mall in the centre of the city and Wondermall on the southwest side.
column2: 该市最大的购物中心是位于城市东南边的万达购物中心、位于市中心的勒泰中心和位于西南边的万象天成购物中心。

column1: The Wanda mall includes an IMAX theatre.
column2: 万达购物中心内有一家 IMAX 影院。

column1: During the summer barbecue restaurants (Chinese: 烧烤) open, selling a whole range of foods, the most popular of which are lamb kebabs (Chinese: 羊肉串).
column2: 夏日时节，烧烤店开张，出售各种食物，其中以羊肉串最受欢迎。

column1: Thousands of restaurants can be found across the city offering a range of Chinese as well as western cuisine open around the clock.
column2: 全市有上千家餐馆，供应一系列中西美食，24 小时营业。

column1: Shijiazhuang Ever Bright F.C. (simplified Chinese: 石家庄永昌;; traditional Chinese: 石家莊永昌;; pinyin: Shíjiāzhuāng Yǒngchāng) is a Chinese football club based in Shijiazhuang, Hebei, which competes in the Chinese Super League.
column2: 石家庄永昌足球俱乐部是一家位于河北石家庄的中国足球俱乐部，参加中国超级联赛的比赛。

column1: It plays in the 37,000-seat Yutong International Sports Centre.
column2: 该队在拥有 37000 个座位的裕彤国际体育中心进行比赛。

column1: The team changed to their current name on February 24, 2014 .
column2: 该队于 2014 年 2 月 24 日改用现名。

column1: Yutong International Sports Center (Chinese: 裕彤国际体育中心) is a multi-use stadium, used mostly for football matches.
column2: 裕彤国际体育中心是一座多用途体育场，主要举行足球比赛。

column1: The capacity is 38,500.
column2: 可容纳 38500 人。

column1: Wei was born and raised in Tainan.
column2: 魏德圣在台南出生长大。

column1: His family ran a clockmaker's shop and attended a Presbyterian church.
column2: 他家经营一家钟表店，并参加一个长老会教堂。

column1: He spent his childhood in the Yongkang District.
column2: 他的童年是在永康区度过的。

column1: According to an interview, Wei watched Taiwanese films "in old, small cinema halls and at an outdoor theater near where he lived." Wei said "It was a bit like Cinema Paradiso".
column2: 根据一次采访，魏德圣“在又老又小的电影院和他住处附近的露天影院”观看台湾电影。魏德圣表示，“有点像天堂电影院。”

column1: The first Hollywood film Wei watched was Sergio Leone's Once Upon a Time in America while Wei was doing his military service.
column2: 魏德圣看的第一部好莱坞电影是塞尔乔·莱昂内的《美国往事》，当时他正在服兵役。

column1: Wei studied Electrical Engineering in Far Eastern Vocational School (Today's Far East University) in Tainan.
column2: 魏德圣曾就读于台南远东工专（现远东科技大学）电机科。

column1: In 1993 or 1994 when Wei was 26, he entered the studio of director Edward Yang as a grip assistant.
column2: 1993 年或 1994 年，当时魏德圣 26 岁，他进入杨德昌导演的工作室担任机械助理。

column1: Later he became an assistant director on Yang's movie Mahjong (1996).
column2: 之后，他成为杨德昌电影《麻将》（1996 年）的副导演。

column1: Later Wei worked odd jobs to fund his own short films, including Three Dialogues (1996) and Before Dawn (1997), which both won a Golden Harvest Award.
column2: 后来，魏德圣打零工筹措资金拍摄自己的短片，包括《对话三部》（1996 年）和《黎明之前》（1997 年），这两部均获得金穗奖。

column1: In an interview Wei said that Yang "taught me to be a perfectionist and not sacrifice one's vision, even on a tight budget...He also told me to use my own life experience and not copy anybody." Wei also said "Having mundane jobs that didn't require me to think allowed me to concentrate on my films in the evening".
column2: 在一次采访中，魏德圣说杨德昌“教我要做一个完美主义者，即使在预算紧张的情况下，也不要牺牲自己的理想…他还告诉我要用我自己的生活经验，不要模仿任何人。”魏德圣还表示，“平淡的工作不需要我动脑思考，这样我就能在晚上集中精力拍自己的电影。”

column1: In 1999, Wei's drama About July, won "a special mention at the Alcan Dragons and Tigers Award for Young Cinema at the Vancouver International Film Festival."
column2: 1999 年，魏徳圣的影片《七月天》获得“温哥华国际电影节青年电影龙虎奖特别提名”。

column1: He later worked on Chen Kuo-fu's movie, Double Vision in 2002.
column2: 他后来在 2002 年参与陈国富电影《双瞳》的拍摄。

column1: Double Vision is one of Columbia Pictures' attempts to make Asian films at the time.
column2: 《双瞳》是哥伦比亚电影公司当时拍摄亚洲电影的尝试之一。

column1: On this film Wei worked as an assistant director and worked with producer Jimmy Huang.
column2: 在这部电影中，魏德胜担任副导演，与制片人黄志明合作。

column1: Their collaboration was important to Wei's career, as Huang would later produce Wei's Cape No.
column2: 他们的合作对魏德圣的事业非常重要，因为黄志明后来制作了魏德圣的《海角

column1: 7 and Seediq Bale.
column2: 七号》和《赛德克·巴莱》。

column1: In addition, the big international investment, technology and effects employed by the film impressed Wei to pursue big-budget filmmaking.
column2: 除此之外，该片采用的国际大投资、大技术和大效果给魏德圣留下深刻印象，从而追求大预算电影制作。

column1: Since 1996, Wei had been trying to make the war epic Seediq Bale, but he could not raise the funds.
column2: 自 1996 年以来，魏德圣一直试图拍摄战争史诗《赛德克·巴莱》，但无法筹到资金。

column1: Double Vision's director, Chen Kuo-fu, suggested that he make a film that could win the people's trust.
column2: 《双瞳》的导演陈国富建议他拍摄一部能赢得人心的电影。

column1: In July 2004, Wei read about a Yunlin postman who successfully delivered a piece of mail addressed in the old Japanese style.
column2: 2004年7月，魏德圣读到一个故事，关于云林的一个邮递员成功投递一封按旧时日本格式书写地址的信件。

column1: Wei decided to make the film, Cape No. 7, based on this story, in the hopes of financing Seediq Bale.
column2: 魏德圣决定以这个故事为蓝本拍摄电影《海角七号》，希望能为《赛德克·巴莱》筹集资金。

column1: Wei finished the script by the end of 2006, and filmed it in the fall of 2007 in Hengchun Peninsula of Pingtung County.
column2: 2006 年底，魏德圣完成了剧本，并于 2007 年春在屏东县恒春半岛摄制该片。

column1: As the production went over budget, Wei had problems securing additional capital; he then refinanced his home and put his family NTD 30 million (nearly USD 900,000) in debt before the release.
column2: 由于制作超预算，魏德胜在获得进一步资金方面遇到了问题，随后，他用自己的房子进行再融资，在上映前给家人欠下 3000 万新台币（近 90 万美元）的债务。

column1: During filming Wei could barely afford the film rolls and lodging for the crew.
column2: 在拍摄过程中，魏德圣几乎负担不起电影胶片和工作人员的住宿费用。

column1: Wei later said this film's zealous reception should help him manage his debts.
column2: 魏德圣后来表示，这部电影受到热烈欢迎，将有助于他管理自己的债务。

column1: Wei believed "that the films that hit the screens before the end of summer vacation in 2007 were all 'safe bets'", because they avoided competition from Hollywood blockbusters.
column2: 魏徳圣认为，“2007 年暑假结束前上映的电影都是‘安全的赌注’”，因为它们避免了与好莱坞大片竞争。

column1: Wei followed this theory when he released Cape No.
column2: 魏徳圣遵循这一理论，当他发行《海角

column1: 7 in 2008. Besides, Wei focused on the promotion of the film.
column2: 七号》在 2008 年。此外，魏徳圣还专注于电影的宣传。

column1: The film was released in August, 2008.
column2: 该片于 2008 年 8 月上映。

column1: It eventually became the 2nd top-selling film in Taiwan history.
column2: 最终成为台湾史上畅销电影第二名。

column1: It raked in 530 million TWD (17.9 million USD) domestically, setting an all-time box office record for a Taiwanese film.
column2: 它在国内横扫 5.3 亿新台币（1790 万美元），创造了台湾电影的历史票房纪录。

column1: Teng Sue-feng points out that Wei got 30% of the profit of Cape No. 7 ("about NT$140 million").
column2: Teng Sue-feng 指出，魏徳圣得到《海角七号》30% 的利润（“约 1.4 亿新台币”）。

column1: Also, Cape No. 7 earned Wei a subsidy of about NTD 100 million from Government Information Office.
column2: 另外，《海角七号》还为魏徳圣从行政院新闻局获得约 1 亿新台币的补贴。

column1: Seediq Bale was released in 2011, but Wei began to work on the film much earlier.
column2: 《赛德克·巴莱》于 2011 年上映，但魏徳圣很早以前就开始制作这部电影。

column1: According to an interview, Wei got the idea to make the film Seediq Bale in 1996 when he saw a protest demanding land to be returned to Taiwanese aborigines.
column2: 据某一次采访所述，当魏徳圣在 1996 年见到要求将土地归还给台湾原住民的抗议活动时，就有了拍摄电影《赛德克·巴莱》的念头。

column1: Wei began to study history relevant to the aborigines and decided to make a film about chief Mona Rudao.
column2: 魏徳圣开始研究与原住民有关的历史，决定拍摄一部关于莫那·鲁道酋长的电影。

column1: In late 2003, Wei raised NTD 2.5 million and shot a five-minute demonstration film in order to further raise NTD 300 million (USD 10 million) to shoot the complete film.
column2: 2003 年末，魏徳圣筹集到 250 万新台币，拍摄了一段五分钟的样片，以便进一步筹集 3 亿新台币（1000 万美元）来拍摄整部电影。

column1: The fundraising failed, and director Chen Kuo-fu advised Wei to make another film to win the trust of investors, so Wei turned his attention to make Cape No. 7.
column2: 筹款失败了，导演陈国富建议魏徳圣再拍一部电影以赢得投资者的信任，于是魏徳圣把注意力转到制作《海角七号》。

column1: After the success of Cape No.
column2: 《海角 取得成功后

column1: 7 in 2008 Wei returned to work on Seediq Bale.
column2: 七号》在 2008 年，魏徳圣回来继续制作《赛德克·巴莱》。

column1: However, in 2009 Typhoon Morakot destroyed the set, and the cost grew from NTD 200 million to NTD 600 million.
column2: 然而在 2009 年，台风“莫拉克”摧毁了摄影棚，成本从 2 亿新台币增加到 6 亿新台币。

column1: Aside from technical problems, Wei said that he had to direct the film and raise the money at the same time, and the company often ran out of money.
column2: 魏徳圣表示，除了技术问题，他还不得不一边执导电影一边筹措资金，公司经常没钱。

column1: Wei said this made him nervous and grouchy, and he had to rely on the patience of the family and employees.
column2: 魏徳圣说，这令他感到紧张和厌烦，他不得不依靠家人和员工的耐心。

column1: The film was released in September 2011, both locally and internationally.
column2: 该片于 2011 年 9 月在当地和国际同步发行。

column1: 52Hz, I Love You is a Mandarin-language musical film that presents a series of romantic comedy stories with original songs that take place in modern Taipei City, Taiwan, on Valentine's Day.
column2: 《52 赫兹，我爱你》是一部华语音乐片，以原创歌曲的形式呈现情人节这天发生在现代台湾台北市的一系列浪漫喜剧故事。

column1: The film's title was inspired by the 52Hz whale, a creature dubbed the "world’s loneliest whale" because no other whales can hear its 52 Hz frequency calls.
column2: 电影标题是受到 52 赫兹鲸鱼的启发，这种生物被称为“世界上最孤独的鲸”，因为没有其他鲸能听到它频率为 52 赫兹的叫声。

column1: As Wei said in a teaser, "Just like how no one hears this lonely whale, how many people have love inside of them but nobody knows?
column2: 正如魏徳圣在预告片中所说，“就像没有人听到这头孤独的鲸鱼，有多少人内心有爱却无人知晓？

column1: Or simply need a chance to say ‘I love you’ and be heard?"
column2: 或者只是需要一个机会说‘我爱你’并被人听到？”

column1: This film was released with special North American advance screenings in October and November 2016 and was released in Taiwan in January 2017.
column2: 该片于 2016 年 10 月和 11 月在北美提前特别上映，2017 年 1 月在台湾上映。

column1: Wei is married and has one son.
column2: 魏徳圣已婚，有一子。

column1: For a time, Gulangyu had the peculiarity of having constituted the only international settlement on Chinese soil apart from the more celebrated International Settlement at Shanghai.
column2: 有一段时间，鼓浪屿的特殊性在于，它是中国境内除了更有名的上海公共租界之外唯一的公共租界。

column1: Soon after Xiamen became a treaty port resulting from China's loss in the First Opium War and the Treaty of Nanking in 1842, foreign residents on the island established an informal organization that became formally organized several decades later when its Land Regulations were approved by the government of China in May 1902.
column2: 由于中国在第一次鸦片战争中战败，1842 年签订南京条约，厦门在成为条约港口后不久，岛上的外国居民就建立了一个非正式组织，几十年后，《厦门鼓浪屿公共地界章程》于 1902 年 5 月获得中国政府批准，因而成为一个正式组织。

column1: Eventually 13 countries, including Great Britain, France, The Netherlands and Japan, were to enjoy extraterritorial privileges there and take part in the Kulangsu Municipal Council that administered the settlement.
column2: 最终，包括英、法、荷、日在内的 13 个国家将在此享有治外法权，并参与管理该租界的鼓浪屿市议会工作。

column1: As with the Shanghai International Settlement, the British played a predominant role in the administration and Sikh policemen from British India were charged with the policing of the Settlement under the Kulangsu Municipal Police.
column2: 与上海公共租界一样，英国人在行政管理中发挥主导作用，来自英属印度的锡克族警察在鼓浪屿市警察的领导下，负责租界治安。

column1: The consulates, churches, hospitals, schools, police stations, etc. built by those foreign communities explain the predominantly Victorian-era style architecture that can still be seen throughout Gulangyu.
column2: 由外国社区修建的领事馆、教堂、医院、学校、警察局等，形成了以维多利亚时代风格为主的建筑，在鼓浪屿上依然随处可见。

column1: Japanese occupation of the island began in 1942, and lasted until the end of World War II.
column2: 日本占领该岛始于 1942 年，直至二战结束。

column1: The Hokkien dialect is spoken on the island, as it is in Xiamen.
column2: 岛上说闽南语，与厦门一样。

column1: After the establishment of the PRC, Gulangyu was a district of Xiamen, one of four in the municipality not located on Xiamen Island until 2003.
column2: 中华人民共和国成立后，鼓浪屿成为厦门的一个区，2003 年以前始终为不在厦门岛内的四个直辖地之一。

column1: In May of that year Gulangyu District was absorbed into Siming District, and has since been administered, policed, and adjudicated from Xiamen Island, just across the Lujiang River.
column2: 那年 5 月，鼓浪屿区并入思明区，此后一直由鹭江对岸的厦门岛负责管理、治安和审判。

column1: Gulangyu is unique in China as a "traffic-free island".
column2: 鼓浪屿作为“无车岛”，在中国独一无二。

column1: It is connected to the main island of Xiamen only by ferry.
column2: 与厦门主岛仅由轮渡相连。

column1: Neither cars nor bicycles are allowed, thus providing an alternative to the frenetic Xiamen Island across the river, although the recent introduction of electric tourist buggies may be damaging the island's charm.
column2: 这里既不允许开车，也不允许骑自行车，从而为河对岸狂热的厦门岛提供了另一种选择，但最近引进了电动旅游观光车可能会有损该岛的魅力。

column1: Freight is pulled on wheeled wooden carts up the often steep lanes by strong teams of men.
column2: 货物由一群强壮的男子，用木轮车沿通常十分陡峭的小路拉到山上。

column1: The spread of Christianity in 1900s brought western music to the island.
column2: 20 世纪初，基督教的传播将西方音乐带到了岛上。

column1: Churches and museums were built, and people enjoyed going to music halls to hear performances.
column2: 教堂和博物馆建造起来，人们乐于去音乐厅聆听演出。

column1: Since then, the island's local cultural environment mingled with introduced foreign music and art, which is why the Gulangyu cultural scene differs from other parts of China.
column2: 从那时起，岛上的本土文化环境与引进的外国音乐和艺术相融合，这就是鼓浪屿的文化场景异于中国其他地方的原因。

column1: A number of China's most famous classical musicians come from Gulangyu, including the pianist Yin Chengzong, the violist Jing Yang, and the pianist Xu Feiping.
column2: 中国一些最著名的古典音乐家均出自鼓浪屿，包括钢琴家殷承宗、小提琴家杨璟和钢琴家许斐平。

column1: Historically, Shu'an Zhou, Junji Lin, and Zuohuang Chen are other well-known classical musicians from the island.
column2: 在历史上，周树安、林俊卿、陈佐湟是其他几位出自该岛的著名古典音乐家。

column1: Gulangyu's piano ownership per capita ranks the first in nation, and by 2002, Gulangyu Island was given the name of "The Island of Music" by Chinese Musicians' Association.
column2: 鼓浪屿的人均钢琴拥有量居全国之首，2002 年中国音乐家协会授予鼓浪屿“音乐之岛”称号。

column1: The piano exhibition halls and museums and overall artistic atmosphere attract many musicians domestically and internationally.
column2: 钢琴展览馆和博物馆以及整体艺术氛围，吸引了国内外许多音乐家。

column1: The 580-seat Gulangyu Concert Hall is one of Fujian Province's most notable acoustic classical music venues.
column2: 可容纳 580 人的鼓浪屿音乐厅是福建省最著名的原声古典音乐场所之一。

column1: The classical violist Jing Yang is from Gulangyu, and also lives on the island.
column2: 小提琴家杨璟来自鼓浪屿，也住在岛上。

column1: In 2005, Gulangyu Island was named the most beautiful district of China by Chinese National Geography magazine.
column2: 2005 年，鼓浪屿被《中国国家地理》杂志评为中国最美丽的地方。

column1: In May 2007, Xiamen Gulangyu Island was officially proved as the National 5A Tourist Attractions by the National Tourism Administration of China.
column2: 2007 年 5 月，厦门鼓浪屿被中国国家旅游局正式认定为“国家级 5A 旅游景区”。

column1: On July 8, 2017, Gulangyu was listed as a World Heritage Site.
column2: 2017 年 7 月 8 日，鼓浪屿被列为世界遗产。

column1: Duck has been roasted in China since the Southern and Northern Dynasties.
column2: 自南北朝以来，中国就有烤鸭。

column1: A variation of roast duck was prepared for the Emperor of China in the Yuan dynasty.
column2: 元朝时，曾为中国皇帝制作过一种别样的烤鸭。

column1: The dish, originally named "shāo yāzi" (燒鴨子), was mentioned in the Complete Recipes for Dishes and Beverages (飲膳正要) manual in 1330 by Hu Sihui (忽思慧), an inspector of the imperial kitchen.
column2: 这道菜原名“烧鸭子”，曾出现在饮膳太医忽思慧写于 1330 年的《饮膳正要》一书中。

column1: The Peking Roast Duck that came to be associated with the term was fully developed during the later Ming dynasty, and by then, Peking Duck was one of the main dishes on imperial court menus.
column2: 与这一称呼相联系的北京烤鸭在明朝后期得到充分发展，在那时，北京烤鸭已成为宫廷菜单上的主要菜肴之一。

column1: The first restaurant specialising in Peking Duck, Bianyifang, was established in the Xianyukou, close to Qianmen of Beijing in 1416.
column2: 1416 年，第一家专门经营北京烤鸭的饭馆“便宜坊”在北京前门附近的鲜鱼口开张。

column1: By the Qianlong Period (1736–1796) of the Qing dynasty, the popularity of Peking Duck spread to the upper classes, inspiring poetry from poets and scholars who enjoyed the dish.
column2: 到了清朝乾隆时期（1736-1796 年），北京烤鸭的人气蔓延到上层社会，喜欢这道菜的诗人、学者们纷纷写诗作赋。

column1: For instance, one verse of Dūmén zhúzhīcí, a Beijing local poem was, "Fill your plates with roast duck and suckling pig".
column2: 例如，北京民间诗歌《都门竹枝词》之一写道，“烤鸭乳猪列满盘”。

column1: In 1864, the Quanjude (全聚德) restaurant was established in Beijing.
column2: 1864 年，全聚德在北京创建。

column1: Yang Quanren (楊全仁), the founder of Quanjude, developed the hung oven to roast ducks.
column2: 全聚德的创始人杨全仁开发了烤鸭用的吊炉。

column1: With its innovations and efficient management, the restaurant became well known in China, introducing the Peking Duck to the rest of the world.
column2: 凭借创新及高效管理，这家饭店在中国广为人知，把北京烤鸭介绍到了世界各地。

column1: By the mid-20th century, Peking Duck had become a national symbol of China, favored by tourists and diplomats alike.
column2: 至 20 世纪中期，北京烤鸭已成为中国的一种国家象征，受到游客和外交官青睐。

column1: For example, Henry Kissinger, the Secretary of State of the United States, met Premier Zhou Enlai in the Great Hall of the People on July 10, 1971, during his first (secret) visit to China.
column2: 例如，美国国务卿基辛格首次（秘密）访华时，于 1971 年 7 月 10 日在人民大会堂与周恩来总理会面。

column1: After a round of inconclusive talks in the morning, the delegation was served Peking Duck for lunch, which became Kissinger's favourite.
column2: 在上午进行了一轮无结果的会谈后，代表团享用北京烤鸭作为午餐，这成了基辛格的最爱。

column1: The Americans and Chinese issued a joint statement the following day, inviting President Richard Nixon to visit China in 1972.
column2: 美中双方次日发表一份联合声明，邀请尼克松总统于 1972 年访问中国。

column1: Following Zhou's death in 1976, Kissinger paid another visit to Beijing to savor Peking Duck.
column2: 1976 年周恩来去世后，基辛格再次访问北京，品尝北京烤鸭。

column1: Peking Duck, at the Quanjude in particular, has also been a favorite dish for various political leaders ranging from Cuban Fidel Castro to former German chancellor Helmut Kohl.
column2: 北京烤鸭，尤其是全聚德的烤鸭，也是从古巴领导人菲德尔·卡斯特罗到德国前总理赫尔穆特·科尔等各国政要最喜欢的菜肴。

column1: Two notable restaurants in Beijing which serve this dish are Quanjude and Bianyifang, both centuries-old establishments which have become household names, each with their own style: Quanjude is known for using the hung oven roasting method, while Bianyifang uses the oldest technique of closed oven roasting.
column2: 在北京供应这道菜的两家饭店是全聚德和便宜坊，这两家都是百年老店，家喻户晓，各有风格：全聚德以挂炉烤制法而闻名，而便宜坊则采用最古老的焖炉烤法。

column1: Fattened ducks are slaughtered, plucked, eviscerated and rinsed thoroughly with water.
column2: 肥鸭经宰杀、去毛、开膛破肚，并用水彻底冲洗。

column1: Air is pumped under the skin through the neck cavity to separate the skin from the fat.
column2: 通过鸭子颈部的洞向皮下灌入空气，使皮与脂肪分离。

column1: The duck is then plunged in boiling water for 1 to 5 minutes, and then hung to dry.
column2: 然后将鸭子在沸水中浸 1 至 5 分钟，随后悬挂晾干。

column1: This will tighten the skin and help the duck to achieve its traditional crispy texture.
column2: 这样可以收紧表皮，有助于鸭子达到传统的酥脆质地。

column1: The duck is then glazed with a layer of potentially spiced and flavored maltose syrup, and the inside is rinsed once more with water.
column2: 然后给鸭子涂上一层可能添加了香料和调味品的麦芽糖浆，内部再次用水冲洗一遍。

column1: A marinade of traditional flavorings, including soy sauce and five-spice powder, and more maltose, is then applied inside the body cavity.
column2: 然后在鸭子体内抹上传统风味的腌料，其中包括酱油、五香粉和更多麦芽糖。

column1: This will flavor the duck during the next step.
column2: 这会在下一步骤中给鸭子增添风味。

column1: The duck is then left to dry for between 24 hours and several days in a cool, dry place (or a refrigerator).
column2: 之后，将鸭子放在阴凉干燥的地方（或冰箱）晾 24 小时至数天。

column1: The drying allows the skin to crisp while roasting.
column2: 风干可以使表皮在烘烤时变脆。

column1: It is then roasted in an oven until the skin turns shiny brown.
column2: 然后在炉中烘烤，直至表皮变成带有光泽的棕色。

column1: While roasting, hot water is added to the body cavity as needed to ensure even cooking and tenderness.
column2: 烤制时，根据需要向鸭子体腔内加热水，以确保均匀受热，肉质鲜嫩。

column1: Some preparations involve the duck being smoked with fruity woods.
column2: 有些做法是用果木熏制鸭子。

column1: Besides traditional methods to prepare Peking Duck, recipes have been compiled by chefs around the world to produce the dish at home.
column2: 除了制作北京烤鸭的传统方法外，世界各地的厨师们还编写了这道菜的家常做法。

column1: Peking duck is originally roasted in a closed oven (Chinese: 焖炉), and Bianyifang is the restaurant that keeps this tradition.
column2: 北京烤鸭最初是在焖炉里烤制，便宜坊是保留这一传统做法的饭店。

column1: The closed oven is built of brick and fitted with metal griddles (Chinese: 箅子; pinyin: bì zi).
column2: 焖炉以砖块砌成，装有金属篦子。

column1: The oven is preheated by burning Gaoliang sorghum straw (Chinese: 秫秸; pinyin: shú jiē) at the base.
column2: 通过在炉底燃烧秫秸来给炉子预热。

column1: The duck is placed in the oven immediately after the fire burns out, allowing the meat to be slowly cooked through the convection of heat within the oven.
column2: 火熄灭后，立即把鸭子放进烤炉，通过烤炉内的热量对流慢慢把肉烤熟。

column1: Controlling the fuel and the temperature is the main skill.
column2: 控制燃料和温度是主要技巧。

column1: In closed-oven style, duck meat is combined well with the fat under the skin, and therefore is juicy and tender.
column2: 在焖炉烤法中，鸭肉与皮下脂肪完美结合，因此鲜嫩多汁。

column1: The open oven (Chinese: 挂炉; literally: 'hung oven') was developed in the imperial kitchens during the Qing Dynasty, and adopted by the Quanjude restaurant chain.
column2: 挂炉在清朝御膳房中发展起来，为全聚德连锁饭店所采用。

column1: It is designed to roast up to 20 ducks at the same time with an open fire fueled by hardwood from peach or pear trees.
column2: 其设计为使用桃木或梨木等硬木明火烤制，可同时烤 20 只鸭子。

column1: The ducks are hung on hooks above the fire and roasted at a temperature of 270 °C (525 °F) for 30–40 minutes.
column2: 鸭子挂在火堆上方的钩子上，以 270 ℃（525 ℉）烤 30-40 分钟。

column1: While the ducks are roasting, the chef may use a pole to dangle each duck closer to the fire for 30-second intervals.
column2: 烤制鸭子时，厨师可以用一根杆子把每只鸭子吊到靠近炉火的位置，间隔 30 秒。

column1: In open-oven style, the fat is usually melted during the cooking process, so the skin is crispy, and can be eaten separately as a snack.
column2: 在吊炉烤法中，脂肪通常已在烹调过程中融化，因此皮很脆，可以作为小吃单独食用。

column1: Almost every part of a duck can be prepared afterwards.
column2: 鸭子几乎所有部位都可用于制作后续菜肴。

column1: Quanjude Restaurant served their customers the "All Duck Banquet" in which they cooked the bones of ducks with vegetables.
column2: 全聚德餐厅为顾客提供“全鸭宴”，将鸭骨与蔬菜一起制成菜肴。

column1: The cooked Peking Duck is traditionally carved in front of the diners and served in three stages.
column2: 传统上，烧好的北京烤鸭是当着食客的面切割的，分三步享用。

column1: First, the duck skin is served with sugar and garlic sauce as dip.
column2: 首先，用鸭皮蘸糖和大蒜酱吃。

column1: The skin tastes better while remaining warm, but it will cool down fast.
column2: 趁热吃，皮的味道更好，但很快会凉。

column1: The meat is then served with steamed pancakes (simplified Chinese: 春饼; traditional Chinese: 春餅; pinyin: chūn bǐng), spring onions and sweet bean sauce.
column2: 接着，把鸭肉与春饼、葱和甜面酱一起食用。

column1: Several vegetable dishes are provided to accompany the meat, typically cucumber sticks.
column2: 会提供几种蔬菜来搭配鸭肉，通常是黄瓜条。

column1: Some restaurants offer watermelon radish sticks as alternative.
column2: 一些餐馆也提供水果萝卜条作为替代。

column1: The diners spread sauce over the pancake.
column2: 食客们把酱料涂抹在春饼上。

column1: Traditionally, the pancake is wrapped around the meat and spring onion, then eaten by hand.
column2: 传统做法是用春饼把肉和葱包起来，用手拿着吃。

column1: Cucumber sticks are eaten as refreshment between Peking Duck rolls, but can also be rolled in the pancake.
column2: 黄瓜条是作为北京烤鸭卷的清口小食来吃的，但也可以卷在春饼里。

column1: The remaining duck (鸭架) can be cooked in three ways.
column2: 剩下的鸭架有三种做法。

column1: The traditional way is to be cooked into a broth.
column2: 传统方法是煮成肉汤。

column1: The meat together with bones can also be stir-fried with sweet bean sauce, or rapidly sautéed and served with salt and Sichuan pepper (椒鹽).
column2: 肉和骨头也可以用甜面酱来炒，或快速翻炒，然后蘸椒盐食用。

column1: Otherwise, they are packed up to be taken home by the customers.
column2: 或者，打包后由顾客带回家。

column1: Whole Peking Ducks can be ordered as takeaways.
column2: 整只北京烤鸭可以外卖订购。

column1: The ducks can be reheated at home with an oven, grill or boiling oil.
column2: 可以用烤箱、烤架或滚油，在家重新加热鸭子。

column1: When an oven is used, the duck is heated at a temperature of 150 °C (300 °F) for 20 minutes, and then at 160 °C (325 °F) for another 10 minutes.
column2: 使用烤箱时，先用 150 ℃（300 ℉）给鸭子加热 20 分钟，然后再用 160 ℃（325 ℉）加热 10 分钟。

column1: The grilling method involves filling the duck with boiling water before placing it on a griddle, 70 cm (28 in) above the cooking fire.
column2: 烧烤法是在鸭子中放满沸水，然后将其放置在离火 70 厘米（28 英寸）的烤盘上。

column1: The boiling water is replaced every 3–4 minutes until the duck's skin is piping hot.
column2: 每隔 3-4 分钟更换一次沸水，直到鸭子表皮变得滚烫。

column1: To reheat the Peking Duck with oil, the duck is sliced into thin pieces and placed in a strainer held over a wok of boiling oil.
column2: 要用油重新加热北京烤鸭，先把鸭子切成薄片，放入架在沸油锅上的滤网内。

column1: The duck is then rinsed several times with the oil.
column2: 然后用油给鸭子淋几遍。

column1: A number of restaurants in Beijing specialise in Peking Duck.
column2: 北京一些餐馆专营北京烤鸭。

column1: Examples include Quanjude, Bianyifang, Changan Yihao (長安一號), Dayali, Beijing Xiaowangfu (北京小王府) and Dadong Kaoyadian (大董烤鴨店).
column2: 例如全聚德、便宜坊、长安一号、大鸭梨、北京小王府和大董烤鸭店。

column1: Some restaurants, in particular Quanjude and Bianyifang, have long histories of serving high quality duck that they are now household names, or Lao zihao (老字號), literally "old brand name".
column2: 一些餐馆，尤其是全聚德和便宜坊，在供应优质烤鸭方面历史悠久，现已家喻户晓，或者说已成为老字号。

column1: In addition, Quanjude has received worldwide recognition, having been named a China Renowned Trademark in 1999.
column2: 此外，全聚德还得到全世界认可，于 1999 年被评为“中国驰名商标”。

column1: Crispy aromatic duck (香酥鴨 xiang su ya) is a similar dish to Peking duck.
column2: 香酥鸭是一道类似于北京烤鸭的菜。

column1: It is very popular in the United Kingdom, where it was created in the latter half of the twentieth century.
column2: 这道菜在英国非常受欢迎，于 20 世纪下半叶在英国创制。

column1: The duck is first marinated with spices, then steamed until tender, and finally deep fried until crispy.
column2: 先用香料腌制鸭子，然后蒸软，最后炸至酥脆。

column1: The meat has less fat and is drier and crispier compared to that of Peking Duck.
column2: 与北京烤鸭相比，鸭肉脂肪更少，更干、更脆。

column1: Crispy aromatic duck can also be seen in the United States, usually served with buns rather than pancakes.
column2: 香酥鸭在美国也有，通常搭配小圆面包，而不是春饼。

column1: In Germany, some Asian fusion restaurants also serve crispy aromatic duck (Knusprige Ente), sometimes also labeled as Peking Duck (Peking-Ente, also Pekingente).
column2: 德国的一些亚洲融合餐厅也供应香酥鸭（Knusprige Ente），有时也被称为北京烤鸭（Peking-Ente 或 Pekingente）。

column1: The duck is marinated with spices and deep-fried, served together with stir-fried vegetables (Wokgemüse) over fried noodles or with rice.
column2: 鸭肉用香料腌制后油炸，与炒蔬菜（Wokgemüse）炒面或米饭一起食用。

column1: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Culture are headquartered in the district.
column2: 外交部和文化部的总部位于这个区。

column1: In 2017,the regional GDP of the district is 563.55 billion yuan, with GDP per capita at 150.7 thousand yuan.
column2: 2017 年，该区的地区国内生产总值（GDP）为 5635.5 亿元人民币，人均 GDP为 15.07 万元人民币。

column1: China National Aviation Holdings Company (parent company of Air China), SOHO China, CITIC Group, Sinopec, Qihoo 360, and Beijing Capital Airlines have their headquarters in Chaoyang District.
column2: 中国航空集团公司（中国国际航空公司的母公司）、SOHO中国、中信集团、中国石化、奇虎 360和首都航空的总部都设在朝阳区。

column1: Renren Inc. has its headquarters on the 23rd floor of the Jing An Center (S: 静安中心, T: 靜安中心, P: Jìng'ān Zhōngxīn) in Chaoyang District.
column2: 人人公司的总部位于朝阳区静安中心 23 层。

column1: Wanda Group has its headquarters in the Wanda Plaza (万达广场).
column2: 万达集团的总部位于万达广场。

column1: Wanda Cinemas is headquartered in the same complex.
column2: 万达影城的总部也在同一个建筑群中。

column1: China Resources Beverage, the distributor of C'estbon water, has its north China regional office in the district.
column2: 华润怡宝是怡宝饮用纯净水的经销商，其华北地区办事处设在这个区。

column1: According to Chaoyang's official website, the district "is home to more than 60 percent of the foreign business agencies in Beijing, over 3,000 foreign companies, 167 international news agencies, and two-thirds of the 158 of the global top 500 transnational companies that have invested in Beijing." Some of these are:
column2: 根据朝阳区官方网站，该区有“60% 以上的外国驻京商务机构，3000 多家外国公司，167 家国际新闻机构，以及已在北京投资的全球 500 强跨国公司中的 158 家公司的三分之二”。其中有：

column1: ABB Group (China headquarters), Air France, All Nippon Airways, (Beijing Office, Beijing Fortune Building) Halliburton, IBM, KBR, Kerr-McGee China Petroleum Ltd. ( an Occidental Petroleum subsidiary), Korean Air (Hyundai Motor Tower (现代汽车大厦 Xiàndài qìchē dàshà)), Kroll Inc., Lummus Technology, a subsidiary of CB&I, Lufthansa (Beijing Lufthansa Center), Asiana Airlines, Standard & Poor's, Swire Group, Etihad Airways, EVA Air, and Qatar Airways.
column2: ABB集团（中国总部）、法国航空、全日空（北京办事处，北京财富大厦）、哈里伯顿、IBM、 KBR 公司、科麦奇中国石油有限公司（西方石油公司的一家子公司）、大韩航空（现代汽车大厦）、Kroll 公司、鲁姆斯公司（西比埃公司的一家子公司）、汉莎航空（北京汉莎中心）、韩亚航空、标准普尔、太古集团、阿提哈德航空、长荣航空和卡塔尔航空。

column1: The Hong Kong-based company Swire Properties has two locations in Chaoyang.
column2: 总部设在香港的太古地产公司在朝阳区有两处办公地点。

column1: Beijing Hyundai Motor Company (BHMC, Chinese: S: 北京现代汽车有限公司, T: 北京現代汽車有限公司, P: Běijīng Xiàndài Qìchē Yǒuxiàngōngsī, Korean: 북경현대), a 50–50 joint venture of the Beijing Automotive Industry Holding Co.
column2: 北京现代汽车有限公司（BHMC）是一家合资企业，由北京汽车工业控股有限责任公司

column1: and Hyundai Motor Company, has its sales offices in the Hyundai Motor Tower in Chaoyang District.
column2: 和现代汽车公司各出资一半，在朝阳区的现代汽车大厦设有销售处。

column1: Chaoyang serves as Beijing's diplomatic district.
column2: 朝阳区是北京的外交区。

column1: All foreign embassies to China are located in the district except for those of Russia and Luxembourg, which are both in Dongcheng.
column2: 除了俄罗斯和卢森堡的大使馆都在东城区之外，所有外国驻华大使馆都位于该区。

column1: Chaoyang has three embassy areas in the Sanlitun, Chaoyangmenwai, and Liangmahe neighborhoods.
column2: 朝阳有三个使馆区，分别位于三里屯、朝阳门外和亮马河。

column1: Chaoyang District is one of the fastest growing districts in the Beijing Metropolitan Area.
column2: 朝阳区是北京都市圈中发展最快的地区之一。

column1: There are several subway lines running through the district.
column2: 有多条地铁线路贯穿该区。

column1: The Beijing Capital Airport, although surrounded by the Shunyi District, is an exclave of Chaoyang District.
column2: 北京首都机场虽然被顺义区包围，却是朝阳区的一块飞地。

column1: The municipality as well as the Chinese national government spend almost a half million USD per day on developing this district.
column2: 市政府和中国国家政府每天花费近五十万美元来发展该区。

column1: CCCC's predecessors can be traced back to the Qing Dynasty, when the Junpu Engineering Bureau was established in 1905.
column2: 中国交建（CCCC）的前身可追溯至清朝，浚浦工程总局于 1905 年成立。

column1: The company was officially formed in 2005 by the combination of China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) and China Harbour Engineering Co. (CHEC), which focus on transportation infrastructure and marine infrastructure, respectively.
column2: 公司于 2005 年正式成立，由中国路桥工程有限责任公司（CRBC）与中国港湾工程有限责任公司（CHEC）合并而成，这两家公司分别以运输基础设施和海上基础设施点为侧重。

column1: In 2006, the company listed shares on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, followed by a listing on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2012.
column2: 2006 年，公司在香港证券交易所上市，2012 年又在上海证券交易所上市。

column1: The company now holds additional subsidiaries: John Holland Group, which is an Australia-based construction company focused on infrastructure; and Friede & Goldman, which engineers offshore vessels for the oil and gas industry.
column2: 公司目前拥有多家子公司：约翰霍兰德集团（John Holland Group），这是一家总部位于澳大利亚，专注于基础设施的建筑公司；以及为石油和天然气行业设计近海船舶的弗里德戈德曼公司（Friede & Goldman）。

column1: CCCC is a "blue chip" stock (part of the CSI 300 Index).
column2: 中国交建是一只蓝筹股（属于沪深300指数）。

column1: China Communications Construction Group (CCCG), a state-owned enterprise, holds 63.8% of the company's shares.
column2: 国有企业中国交通建设集团有限公司（CCCG）持有公司 63.8% 的股份。

column1: Other shareholders include multiple affiliates of (or funds managed by) Merrill Lynch, BlackRock and JPMorgan Chase.
column2: 其他股东包括美林证券、贝莱德和摩根大通的多家关联公司（或由其管理的基金）。

column1: A large dam across the Yangtze River was originally envisioned by Sun Yat-sen in The International Development of China, in 1919.
column2: 1919 年，孙中山在《实业计划》中最早提出修建一座横跨长江的大坝的设想。

column1: He stated that a dam capable of generating 30 million horsepower (22 GW) was possible downstream of the Three Gorges.
column2: 他认为，有可能在三峡下游修建一座发电量为 3000 万马力（22 吉瓦）的大坝。

column1: In 1932, the Nationalist government, led by Chiang Kai-shek, began preliminary work on plans in the Three Gorges.
column2: 1932 年，蒋介石领导的国民党政府开始进行三峡工程的初步规划。

column1: In 1939, Japanese military forces occupied Yichang and surveyed the area.
column2: 1939 年，日本军队占领宜昌并对该地区进行勘测。

column1: A design, the Otani plan, was completed for the dam in anticipation of a Japanese victory over China.
column2: 在预期日本对中国取得胜利的情况下，完成了一份大坝设计，即大谷（音译）计划。

column1: In 1944, the United States Bureau of Reclamation head design engineer, John L. Savage, surveyed the area and drew up a dam proposal for the 'Yangtze River Project'.
column2: 1944 年，美国垦务局设计总工程师萨凡奇实地勘测这一地区，为“扬子江工程”拟定了一份大坝方案。

column1: Some 54 Chinese engineers went to the U.S. for training.
column2: 约 54 名中国工程师被派往美国参加培训。

column1: The original plans called for the dam to employ a unique method for moving ships; the ships would move into locks located at the lower and upper ends of the dam and then cranes with cables would move the ships from one lock to the next.
column2: 最初的计划要求大坝采用一种独特的方法来移动船只；船只进入位于大坝底部和顶部的水闸，然后用电缆吊车将船只从一个水闸移到下一个水闸。

column1: In the case of smaller water craft, groups of craft would be lifted together for efficiency.
column2: 对于较小的船只，为提高效率起见，将多组船只一同吊起。

column1: It is not known whether this solution was considered for its water-saving performance or because the engineers thought the difference in height between the river above and below the dam too great for alternative methods.
column2: 尚不清楚这一解决方案是考虑到能够节水，还是因为工程师认为大坝上下江面高度差太大而无法采用其他方法。

column1: Some exploration, survey, economic study, and design work was done, but the government, in the midst of the Chinese Civil War, halted work in 1947.
column2: 虽然已经完成了一些勘探、测绘、经济研究和设计工作，但由于国共内战，政府于 1947 年停止了这项工作。

column1: After the 1949 Communist takeover, Mao Zedong supported the project, but began the Gezhouba Dam project nearby first, and economic problems including the Great Leap Forward and the Cultural Revolution slowed progress.
column2: 1949 年中国共产党接管政权后，毛泽东支持这个项目，首先在附近开建葛洲坝工程，包括大跃进和文化大革命在内的经济问题使进展缓慢。

column1: After the 1954 Yangtze River Floods, in 1956, Mao Zedong authored "Swimming", a poem about his fascination with a dam on the Yangtze River.
column2: 1954 年长江洪水之后，毛泽东于 1956 年创作了诗歌《水调歌头·游泳》，表达了他对在长江上修建一座大坝的强烈意愿。

column1: In 1958, after the Hundred Flowers Campaign, some engineers who spoke out against the project were imprisoned.
column2: 1958 年，在“百花齐放”整风运动之后，一些公开反对这项工程的工程师被关进监狱。

column1: During the 1980s, the idea of a dam reemerged.
column2: 20 世纪 80 年代，修建大坝的想法再次出现。

column1: The National People's Congress approved the dam in 1992: out of 2,633 delegates, 1,767 voted in favour, 177 voted against, 664 abstained, and 25 members did not vote.
column2: 1992 年全国人民代表大会批准修建大坝：在 2633 名代表中，1767 票赞成，177 票反对，664 票弃权，还有 25 人未投票。

column1: Construction started on December 14, 1994. The dam was expected to be fully operational in 2009, but additional projects, such as the underground power plant with six additional generators, delayed full operation until May 2012.
column2: 工程于 1994 年 12 月 14 日动工。预计大坝将于 2009 年全面投入运营，但其他项目（例如配备 6 台发电机的地下发电厂）的全面运营推迟至 2012 年 5 月。

column1: The ship lift was completed in 2015.
column2: 升船机于 2015 年建成。

column1: The dam had raised the water level in the reservoir to 172.5 m (566 ft) above sea level by the end of 2008 and the designed maximum level of 175 m (574 ft) by October 2010.
column2: 到 2008 年底，大坝已使水库水位升至海拔 172.5 米（566 英尺），2010 年 10 月达到设计最高水位 175米（574 英尺）。

column1: Made of concrete and steel, the dam is 2,335 m (7,661 ft) long and the top of the dam is 185 m (607 ft) above sea level.
column2: 大坝由钢筋混凝土和钢材建造，长 2335 米（7661 英尺），坝顶海拔 185米（607 英尺）。

column1: The project used 27.2×10⁶ m³ (35.6×10⁶ cu yd) of concrete (mainly for the dam wall), used 463,000 T of steel (enough to build 63 Eiffel Towers), and moved about 102.6×10⁶ m³ (134.2×10⁶ cu yd) of earth.
column2: 该项目使用了 27.2×10⁶ 立方米（35.6×10⁶ 立方码）混凝土（主要用于坝墙），使用了 46.3 万吨钢材（足以建造 63 座埃菲尔铁塔），并移走约 102.6×10⁶ 立方米（134.2×10⁶ 立方码）土方。

column1: The concrete dam wall is 181 m (594 ft) high above the rock basis.
column2: 混凝土坝墙高出岩石基座 181 米（594 英尺）。

column1: When the water level is at its maximum of 175 m (574 ft) above sea level, 110 m (361 ft) higher than the river level downstream, the dam reservoir is on average about 660 km (410 mi) in length and 1.12 km (3,675 ft) in width.
column2: 当水位处于最高位海拔 175 米（574 英尺）时，比下游河面高出 110 米（361英尺），坝区水库平均长 660 公里（410 英里），宽 1.12 公里（3675 英尺）。

column1: It contains 39.3 km³ (31,900,000 acre⋅ft) of water and has a total surface area of 1,045 km² (403 sq mi).
column2: 蓄水 39.3 立方千米（3190 万英亩英尺），总表面积为 1045 平方公里（403 平方英里）。

column1: On completion, the reservoir flooded a total area of 632 km² (244 sq mi) of land, compared to the 1,350 km² (520 sq mi) of reservoir created by the Itaipu Dam.
column2: 完工后，水库淹没区总面积为 632 平方公里（244 平方英里），而伊泰普大坝形成的水库为 1350 平方公里（520 平方英里）。

column1: The government estimated that the Three Gorges Dam project would cost 180 billion yuan (US$22.5 billion).
column2: 政府预估三峡大坝工程将耗资 1800 亿元人民币（225 亿美元）。

column1: By the end of 2008, spending had reached 148.365 billion yuan, among which 64.613 billion yuan was spent on construction, 68.557 billion yuan on relocating affected residents, and 15.195 billion yuan on financing.
column2: 截至 2008 年底，支出已达 1483.65 亿元人民币，其中建设支出 646.13 亿元，居民搬迁安置支出 685.57 亿元，融资支出 151.95 亿元。

column1: It was estimated in 2009 that the construction cost would be recovered when the dam had generated 1,000 terawatt-hours (3,600 PJ) of electricity, yielding 250 billion yuan.
column2: 据估计 2009 年就可收回建设成本，届时大坝发电 1000 太瓦时（3600 拍焦），收益 2500 亿元人民币。

column1: Full cost recovery was thus expected to occur ten years after the dam started full operation, but the full cost of the Three Gorges Dam was recovered by December 20, 2013.
column2: 因此，预计将在三峡大坝全面运行十年后收回全部成本，但到 2013 年 12 月 20 日，三峡大坝已收回全部成本。

column1: Funding sources include the Three Gorges Dam Construction Fund, profits from the Gezhouba Dam, loans from the China Development Bank, loans from domestic and foreign commercial banks, corporate bonds, and revenue from both before and after the dam is fully operational.
column2: 资金来源包括三峡大坝建设基金、葛洲坝的利润、国家开发银行贷款、国内外商业银行贷款、公司债券以及大坝全面运行前后的收入。

column1: Additional charges were assessed as follows: Every province receiving power from the Three Gorges Dam had to pay ¥7.00 per MWh extra.
column2: 加收费用计算如下：接收三峡电力的各省加收每兆瓦时 7 元的额外费用。

column1: Other provinces had to pay an additional charge of ¥4.00 per MWh.
column2: 其他省份加收每兆瓦时 4 元的额外费用。

column1: The Tibet Autonomous Region pays no surcharge.
column2: 西藏自治区无需支付额外费用。

column1: Power generation is managed by China Yangtze Power, a listed subsidiary of China Three Gorges Corporation (CTGC)—a Central Enterprise SOE administered by SASAC.
column2: 发电由中国长江电力股份有限公司管理，该公司为国资委（SASAC）管理的国有央企中国长江三峡集团有限公司（CTGC）的上市子公司。

column1: The Three Gorges Dam is the world's largest capacity hydroelectric power station with 34 generators: 32 main generators, each with a capacity of 700 MW, and two plant power generators, each with capacity of 50 MW, making a total capacity of 22,500 MW.
column2: 三峡大坝是世界上容量最大的水力发电站，共有 34 台发电机：32 台主发电机，每台容量 700 兆瓦，两台电站发电机，每台容量 50 兆瓦，总容量 22500 兆瓦。

column1: Among those 32 main generators, 14 are installed in the north side of the dam, 12 in the south side, and the remaining six in the underground power plant in the mountain south of the dam.
column2: 在这 32 台主发电机中，14 台安装在大坝北侧，12 台安装在大坝南侧，其余 6 台安装在大坝南侧山体的地下发电站中。

column1: Annual electricity generation in 2015 was 87 TWh, which is 20 times more than the Hoover Dam.
column2: 2015 年发电 87 太瓦时，是胡佛大坝的 20 倍。

column1: The main generators weigh about 6,000 tonnes each and are designed to produce more than 700 MW of power.
column2: 主发电机每台重约 6000 吨，设计发电量逾 700 兆瓦。

column1: The designed head of the generator is 80.6 meters (264 ft).
column2: 发电机水头设计为 80.6 米（264 英尺）。

column1: The flow rate varies between 600–950 cubic metres per second (21,000–34,000 cu ft/s) depending on the head available.
column2: 根据可用水头的不同，流量在每秒 600-950 立方米（21000-34000 立方英尺/秒）之间变化。

column1: The greater the head, the less water needed to reach full power.
column2: 水头越大，达到满功率所需的水量就越少。

column1: Three Gorges uses Francis turbines.
column2: 三峡采用混流式涡轮机。

column1: Turbine diameter is 9.7/10.4 m (VGS design/Alstom's design) and rotation speed is 75 revolutions per minute.
column2: 涡轮直径为 9.7/10.4 米（VGS 设计/ ALSTOM 设计），转速为每分钟 75 转。

column1: This means that in order to generate power at 50 Hz, the generator rotors have 80 poles.
column2: 这表示要在 50 赫兹下发电，发电机转子要有 80 个极点。

column1: Rated power is 778 MVA, with a maximum of 840 MVA and a power factor of 0.9.
column2: 额定功率 778 兆伏安，最大 840 兆伏安，功率因数 0.9。

column1: The generator produces electrical power at 20 kV.
column2: 发电机产生 20 千伏的电力。

column1: The electricity generated is then stepped-up to 500 kV for transmission at 50 Hz.
column2: 然后产生的电被增加到 500 千伏，以 50 赫兹传输。

column1: The outer diameter of the generator stator is 21.4/20.9 m.
column2: 发电机定子的外径为 21.4/20.9 米。

column1: The inner diameter is 18.5/18.8 m.
The stator, the biggest of its kind, is 3.1/3 m in height.
column2: 最大的定子高 3.1/3米。

column1: Bearing load is 5050/5500 tonnes.
Average efficiency is over 94%, and reaches 96.5%.
column2: 平均效率超过 94% ，达到 96.5%。

column1: The generators were manufactured by two joint ventures: one of them Alstom, ABB Group, Kvaerner, and the Chinese company Harbin Motor; the other Voith, General Electric, Siemens (abbreviated as VGS), and the Chinese company Oriental Motor.
column2: 发电机由两个联营体制造：其中一个是阿尔斯通、ABB 集团、克瓦纳集团和中国企业哈尔滨电机厂；另一个是福伊特公司、通用电器、西门子（缩写 VGS）和中国企业东方电机有限公司。

column1: The technology transfer agreement was signed together with the contract.
column2: 技术转让协议与合同一起签订。

column1: Most of the generators are water-cooled.
column2: 大多数发电机为水冷式。

column1: Some newer ones are air-cooled, which are simpler in design and manufacture and are easier to maintain.
column2: 一些较新的发电机为风冷式，在设计和制造上更简单，更易维护。

column1: The first north side main generator (No. 2) started on July 10, 2003; the north side became completely operational September 7, 2005, with the implementation of generator No. 9.
column2: 2003 年 7 月 10 日，第一台北侧主发动机（2 号）启动；2005 年 9 月 7 日，9 号发电机正式投入使用，北侧全面运行。

column1: Full power (9,800 MW) was only reached on October 18, 2006, after the water level reached 156 m.
column2: 直至 2006 年 10 月 18 日才实现全功率（9800 兆瓦），当时水位已达 156 米。

column1: The 12 south side main generators are also in operation.
column2: 南侧的 12 台主发电机也在运行中。

column1: No. 22 began operation on June 11, 2007, and No. 15 started up on October 30, 2008. The sixth (No. 17) began operation on December 18, 2007, raising capacity to 14.1 GW, finally surpassing Itaipu (14.0 GW), to become the world's largest hydro power plant by capacity.
column2: 22 号于 2007 年 6 月 11 日投入运行，15 号于 2008 年 10 月 30 日开始运行。第六台（17 号）于 2007 年 12 月 18 日开始运行，使得装机容量达到 14.1吉瓦，最终超过伊泰普水电站（14.0 吉瓦），成为世界上装机容量最大的水电站。

column1: As of May 23, 2012, when the last main generator, No. 27, finished its final test, the six underground main generators are also in operation, raising capacity to 22.5 GW.
column2: 截至 2012 年 5 月 23 日，最后一台主发电机 27 号完成最终测试，6 台地下主发电机也开始运行，装机容量升至 22.5 吉瓦。

column1: After nine years of construction, installation and testing, the power plant is now fully operational.
column2: 经过九年的施工、安装和测试，发电厂现已全面运行。

column1: The State Grid Corporation and China Southern Power Grid paid a flat rate of ¥250 per MWh (US$35.7) until July 2, 2008.
column2: 至 2008 年 7 月 2 日，国家电网和中国南方电网支付的统一费率为每兆瓦时 250 元人民币（35.7 美元）。

column1: Since then, the price has varied by province, from ¥228.7–401.8 per MWh.
column2: 从那以后，价格因省而异，每兆瓦时 228.7-401.8 元。

column1: Higher-paying customers, such as Shanghai, receive priority.
column2: 付费较高的客户，比如上海，获得优先权。

column1: Nine provinces and two cities consume power from the dam.
column2: 九省两市使用三峡电力。

column1: Power distribution and transmission infrastructure cost about 34.387 billion Yuan.
column2: 输配电基础设施成本约为 343.87 亿元人民币。

column1: Construction was completed in December 2007, one year ahead of schedule.
column2: 施工于 2007 年 12 月完工，比计划提前了一年。

column1: Power is distributed over multiple 500 kilovolt (kV) transmission lines.
column2: 电力由多条 500 千伏（kV）输电线路进行传输。

column1: Three direct current (DC) lines to the East China Grid carry 7,200 MW: Three Gorges – Shanghai (3,000 MW), HVDC Three Gorges – Changzhou (3,000 MW), and HVDC Gezhouba – Shanghai (1,200 MW).
column2: 输往华东电网的三条直流（DC）线路承载 7200 兆瓦：三峡-上海（3000 兆瓦）、高压直流（HVDC）三峡-常州（3000 兆瓦）和高压直流（HVDC）葛洲坝-上海（1200 兆瓦）。

column1: The alternating current (AC) lines to the Central China Grid have a total capacity of 12,000 MW. The DC transmission line HVDC Three Gorges – Guangdong to the South China Grid has a capacity of 3,000 MW.
column2: 输往华中电网的交流电（AC）线路总容量为 12000 兆瓦。直流输电线路高压直流（HVDC）三峡-广东至华南电网的容量为 3000 兆瓦。

column1: The dam was expected to provide 10% of China's power.
column2: 预计大坝将提供中国 10% 的电力。

column1: However, electricity demand has increased more quickly than previously projected.
column2: 然而，电力需求增长比之前预计的要快。

column1: Even fully operational, on average, it supports only about 1.7% of electricity demand in China in the year of 2011, when the Chinese electricity demand reached 4692.8 TWh.
column2: 即使全线运行，2011 年平均仅支持全国用电需求的 1.7% 左右，这一年全国用电需求达到 4692.8 太瓦时。

column1: According to the National Development and Reform Commission of China, 366 grams of coal would produce 1 kWh of electricity during 2006.
column2: 根据国家发改委的数据，2006 年 366 克煤可产生 1 千瓦时的电。

column1: At full power, Three Gorges reduces coal consumption by 31 million tonnes per year, avoiding 100 million tonnes of greenhouse gas emissions, millions of tonnes of dust, one million tonnes of sulfur dioxide, 370,000 tonnes of nitric oxide, 10,000 tonnes of carbon monoxide, and a significant amount of mercury.
column2: 全线发电时，三峡每年可减少 3100 万吨煤炭消耗，避免排放 1 亿吨温室气体、数百万吨粉尘、100 万吨二氧化硫、37 万吨一氧化氮、1 万吨一氧化碳和大量的汞。

column1: Hydropower saves the energy needed to mine, wash, and transport the coal from northern China.
column2: 水电节约了开采、洗选和从中国北方运输煤炭所需的能源。

column1: From 2003 to 2007, power production equaled that of 84 million tonnes of standard coal, reducing carbon dioxide by 190 million tonnes, sulfur dioxide by 2.29 million tonnes, and nitrogen oxides by 980,000 tonnes.
column2: 2003 年至 2007 年，发电量相当于 8400 万吨标准煤，减少了 1.9 亿吨二氧化碳、229 万吨二氧化硫和98 万吨氮氧化物。

column1: The dam increased the Yangtze's barge capacity sixfold, reducing carbon dioxide emission by 630,000 tonnes.
column2: 三峡大坝使长江的驳船能力提高了六倍，减少了 63 万吨二氧化碳排放。

column1: From 2004 to 2007, a total of 198 million tonnes of goods passed through the ship locks.
column2: 2004 年至 2007 年，共有 1.98 亿吨货物通过船闸。

column1: Compared to using trucking, barges reduced carbon dioxide emission by ten million tonnes and lowered costs by 25%.
column2: 与卡车运输相比，驳船的二氧化碳排放量减少了 1000 万吨，成本降低 25%。

column1: Erosion in the reservoir, induced by rising water, causes frequent major landslides that have led to noticeable disturbance in the reservoir surface, including two incidents in May 2009 when somewhere between 20,000 and 50,000 cubic metres (26,000 and 65,000 cu yd) of material plunged into the flooded Wuxia Gorge of the Wu River.
column2: 水位上升导致对水库的侵蚀，造成重大山体滑坡频繁发生，已对水库表面造成明显干扰，其中包括 2009 年 5 月的两起事件，当时有 2 万至 5 万立方米（26000 和 65000 立方码）的物质坠入被淹没的乌江巫峡地区。

column1: Also, in the first four months of 2010, there were 97 significant landslides.
column2: 此外，2010 年前四个月发生了 97 起重大滑坡。

column1: The dam catalyzed improved upstream wastewater treatment around Chongqing and its suburban areas.
column2: 大坝促进了重庆及其郊区周围上游污水处理的改善。

column1: According to the Ministry of Environmental Protection, as of April 2007, more than 50 new plants could treat 1.84 million tonnes per day, 65% of the total need.
column2: 环境保护部数据显示，截至 2007 年 4 月，50 多家新工厂每天可处理 184 万吨，占总需求的 65%。

column1: About 32 landfills were added, which could handle 7,664.5 tonnes of solid waste every day.
column2: 增加了大约 32个垃圾填埋场，每天可处理 7664.5 吨固体垃圾。

column1: Over one billion tons of wastewater are released annually into the river, which was more likely to be swept away before the reservoir was created.
column2: 每年有超过 10 亿吨废水排放到河流中，这些废水在水库建成之前更有可能被冲走。

column1: This has left the water looking stagnant, polluted and murky.
column2: 使河水看起来死气沉沉，污染严重，浑浊不堪。

column1: In 1997, the Three Gorges area had 10% forestation, down from 20% in the 1950s.
column2: 1997 年，三峡地区绿化面积从 20 世纪 50 年代的 20% 降至 10%。

column1: Research by the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization suggested that the Asia-Pacific region would, overall, gain about 6,000 km² (2,300 sq mi) of forest by 2008.
column2: 联合国粮农组织的研究表明，到 2008 年，亚太地区森林总面积将增加约 6000 平方公里（2300 平方英里）。

column1: That is a significant change from the 13,000 km² (5,000 sq mi) net loss of forest each year in the 1990s.
column2: 这与 20 世纪 90 年代每年净损失 13000 平方公里（5000 平方英里）森林相比，变化显著。

column1: This is largely due to China's large reforestation effort.
column2: 这主要是由于中国大规模的植树造林工作。

column1: This accelerated after the 1998 Yangtze River floods convinced the government that it must restore tree cover, especially in the Yangtze's basin upstream of the Three Gorges Dam.
column2: 这一趋势在 1998 年长江洪水之后得到加速，这场大洪水使政府确信必须恢复树木覆盖，尤其是在三峡大坝上游长江流域。

column1: In 2010, NASA scientists calculated that shift of water mass stored by the dams would increase the length of the Earth's day by 0.06 microseconds and make the Earth slightly more round in the middle and flat on the poles.
column2: 2010 年，美国国家航空航天局（NASA）科学家计算得出，大坝储水量变化将使地球白天的长度增加 0.06 微秒，并使地球中间略圆，两极略平。

column1: An important function of the dam is to control flooding, which is a major problem for the seasonal river of the Yangtze.
column2: 大坝的一大作用是控制洪水，这是长江作为季节性河流的一个主要问题。

column1: Millions of people live downstream of the dam, with many large, important cities like Wuhan, Nanjing, and Shanghai situated adjacent to the river.
column2: 数百万人生活在大坝下游，武汉、南京和上海等许多重要的大城市都毗邻长江河道。

column1: Plenty of farm land and China's most important industrial area are built beside the river.
column2: 大量农田和中国最重要的工业区都沿江而建。

column1: The reservoir's flood storage capacity is 22 cubic kilometres (5.3 cu mi; 18,000,000 acre⋅ft).
column2: 水库蓄洪能力为 22 立方公里 （5.3 立方英里；1800 万英亩英尺）。

column1: This capacity will reduce the frequency of major downstream flooding from once every 10 years to once every 100 years.
column2: 这一能力将使下游发生大洪水的频率从十年一遇降至百年一遇。

column1: The dam is expected to minimize the effect of even a "super" flood.
column2: 预计大坝将尽可能减小哪怕是“超级”洪水的影响。

column1: Jiro Wang was born August 24, 1981, in Taiwan.
column2: 汪东城 1981 年 8 月 24 日出生于台湾。

column1: He graduated from Fu Shin Trade and Arts College with a degree in Advertising Design.
column2: 他毕业于复兴高级商工职业学院广告设计科。

column1: Wang's father died when he was 18, leaving him and his mother stranded with the family debt.
column2: 父亲在他 18 岁时去世，给他和母亲留下家庭债务，生活困顿。

column1: To pay off the enormous debt, Wang worked three jobs at a time, which variously included flyer distribution, dressing up as a mascot for Taipei's Zoo Mall, waiting tables at a bar, a fashion retail assistant, a part-time model, and even hard labor work as a construction worker.
column2: 为了偿还巨额债务，汪东城同时打三份工，其中包括发传单、装扮成台北市动物园购物中心吉祥物、在酒吧当服务员、做时装零售助理、当兼职模特，甚至还做过建筑工人的苦力活。

column1: Upon graduation from arts college, he entered the commercial and modeling industry.
column2: 从艺术学校毕业后，他进入商业和模特行业。

column1: BMG, the label that signed him, planned to package him with Jay Chou and Jordan Chan under the "3J Plan", but when BMG's stocks crashed following 9/11, the 3J plan was scrapped.
column2: BMG 公司把他签下，计划将他与周杰伦、陈小春包装成“3J 计划”， 但9/11 之后 BMG 股票崩盘，3J 计划被取消。

column1: Wang then decided to continue his career in the industry via commercial modeling and working backstage in fashion design.
column2: 随后，汪东城决定通过做商业模特以及时装设计的后台工作，继续自己在这一行的职业生涯。

column1: He was approached again around 2004, launching the start of his acting career.
column2: 2004 年前后，再次有人找到他，开启了他的演艺生涯。

column1: He speaks fluent Taiwanese and Mandarin, and understands conversational English.
column2: 他会说流利的闽南语和普通话，也能听懂英语会话。

column1: His early difficult financial circumstances made him a firm believer in helping those in need and the privilege of being able to give.

column1: Though he has used his celebrity status to aid charitable organizations such as Taiwan's Syinlu Social Welfare Foundation to raise funds and awareness for those with intellectual disabilities—such as shooting the micro-film entitled Seeing and designing packaging for the sale of their handicrafts—he remains largely low-profile about his personal charitable contributions.

column1: On 14 February 2010, Wang started his own fashion label M JO <http://mjo.com.tw/index.html>.

column1: Despite his popularity, Wang regretfully chose to eventually withdraw from the contest due to a conflict in KO One Re-act's filming schedule and Transformers 4's training schedule, choosing to honor his prior filming commitments in order not to hold up KO One Re-act's production team—which was still filming scenes and had already gone on-air in Taiwan and online in Mainland China.
column2: 尽管他人气很高，但由于《终极一班 3》的拍摄计划与《变形金刚 4》的训练计划有冲突，为了不耽误《终极一班 3》的制作团队（仍在拍摄场景，并且已经在台湾上映，也已在中国大陆网上播出），汪东城选择履行之前许下的拍摄承诺，最终遗憾退出。

During a media interview at a promotional event for the KO One Re-act television series, Wang reiterated his thanks for fans' warm support.
